Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel and wonderful service”
Reviews.Author: Jennifer M
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Four Seasons Miami at the end of a family Spring Break trip. The staff treated our young children fabulously, and my husband & I loved the hotel's amenities. I'd highly recommend this hotel, particularly for business travelers.

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: maria r
Reviews.Content: i could only said that they charge you for the internet service, it shoulld be complimentary as in any hotel like this. for the rest is just excellent, service, food, location, rooms.

Reviews.Title: “fabulous view from an apartment type room”
Reviews.Author: JerCurtis S
Reviews.Content: The service at the Four Seasons Miami was astounding. Upon check in I was escorted to the lobby by a lovely girl who actually knew our names. We were offered a 1200 ft suite upgrade that turned out to be outstanding. With a great lunch on the pool deck we set off to South Beach but found it to have lost its luster from my last visit 2 years ago. We went back to the Four Seasons to bast in the sun at the magnificient pool. The clientele at the Four Seasons had a definite international flavor, making our mini vacation all the more exciting. The only complaint I have is the gift shop is small with few offerings, but I guess I have enough coffee mugs anyway.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty as can be”
Reviews.Author: afelric1
Reviews.Content: This hotel was great every time I've been there. Great service, great staff, good food, and beautiful!

Reviews.Title: “Location worked well”
Reviews.Author: Dee B
Reviews.Content: Before traveling here I noticed many of the reviews stated that this was located in a business area vs. beach area and I liked that! There was a special to get a third night free which made this an awesome value. The art was a nice treat ... be sure to browse the lobby for interesting finds.

Reviews.Title: “The best service”
Reviews.Author: Patricia E
Reviews.Content: The four seasons MIami is among the best hotels i have been, the service is great from the door to the operator. There is nothing i asked or try that had less than great service, the food is really good, and they send it to you on a time limit that never fails, seems you have the hole hotel staff af your service all the time!. The beds are soft and the rooms are spacious, the bathroom are big and they have the best shower with a lot of pressure. Everything is first class!

Reviews.Title: “Never a bad experience”
Reviews.Author: david l
Reviews.Content: Like usual Four Season's standards are excellent !

Reviews.Title: “Great service, beautiful hotel, worth the price.”
Reviews.Author: Js3591
Reviews.Content: Spent a single night at the 4S before heading out on a cruise. Would have stayed at the 4S if I hadn't paid for the cruise! Great rooms, nice friendly service, not pretentious, make you feel very welcome. Pool area and attendants are great.

Reviews.Title: “This Four Seasons was a great expereience. Serenity, Peace and Luxury all my favorite experiences.”
Reviews.Author: KazChing
Reviews.Content: This was a great hotel away from the crazyness of Southbeach yet close enough to get to for dinners in the evening. Staff and service was excellent. We enjoyed the pool area and service. I definitely recomment this for business or pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “Great for other hotels, very good for the Four Seasons-”
Reviews.Author: Famishedtraveler
Reviews.Content: Recently spent a long weekend at Four Seasons Miami. I got a great rate and was looking to do nothing but unwind at the pool and have some good dinners. It was perfect for that. First off, it's the Four Seasons with all that comes with that. Hotel was immaculate and beautiful. Rooms were big, staff was friendly and helpful. Pool area is fantastic with large pool, lots of chairs and cabanas and hammocks hanging from palm trees in a fake lagoon. Note, it's in the Financial District so not a party area and there is no beach. There is a fun area that is 15 minutes walking or one stop on train that I think is called 10th Street Promenade/Brikell Village. Lots of restaurants, bars, etc. and always seemed crowded and lively. A couple of points that could be improved with hotel-- the first day we sat at the far end of the pool and it seemed that the pool staff would serve one side or the other and never come to the end. That would be fine, but they were not trained to look around to see EVERYONE at the end of the pool waiving at them to get service. Other days we sat elsewhere and service was great. Also, service just seemed a little slow everywhere at the hotel. Maybe Miami is just on a different clock since it seemed that way most places we went to. Finally, check out only had 1 person at desk and 4 people in line. It took much longer than it should have. Please note, for any other hotel chain this would have gone unnoticed but for a Four Seasons it seemed a bit lacking compared to the others I have stayed at. As for the area-- Azul at the Mandarin (as well as the bar and bartender there) were outstanding -- it's a 1 mile walk or a quick cab ride. Also, Four Seasons has amazing sunday brunch. It's the kind you read about. All you can eat everything including a chilled seafood bar-- great for special occasions -- note that it's $75 but includes alcohol. Trulucks just down the street was also excellent for dinner with a good bar and live entertainment (entertainer was terrible when we were there but hopefully changes nightly).

Reviews.Title: “great stay at four seasons”
Reviews.Author: YorkshireGirl33
Reviews.Content: We stayed 5 nights in February and both the service and quality were excellent. We really enjoyed the Edge steakhouse and bar and the happy hour 2 for 1 drinks and $1 oysters/beef skewers were great between 3 and 7 daily. All staff were really helpful and friendly and we also made use of the free coffee available every morning up yo 8am

Reviews.Title: “Running away from South Beach”
Reviews.Author: Gabriel S
Reviews.Content: We had finally the chance of a weekend escapade with my wife this last PresidentÂ´s Day holiday. We chose Miami for convenience and looking for some warm weather. We are regulars in the Miami hotel scene â€“although we live in DC- and have had our fistful of mediocre and bad experiences. Our initial booking was at the Lowes Hotel in South Beach, wanting to try something new. My wife arrived first and called me from the check-in line. The staff, the guests, and the whole experience from the beginning were not meant for us. Expensive, dirty, bad attitude, all of that starting at the front desk. She had to stay for the night while we search for alternatives. I believe she said I had a coronary or something of that sort, just to be able to run away. We were very lucky to book a room the next day at Four Seasons, on Brickell Avenue. Not a small feat taking into account that this weekend the Miami Boat and Sail Show and the Coconut Grove Art Festival were taking place. The Four Seasons is a superb hotel. Starting with the art in the lobby and in the reception. When you arrive a Botero beauty welcomes you. And also some of the most attractive glass pieces I have seen lately. It was packed but you always felt the special treatment. You could see that the 100 % occupancy was taxing the staff but they kept a courteous attitude and kind service. The new EDGE steak house is a top-notch restaurant and bar with great food and hip ambiance; also room service is the best. I need to compare this experience with what happened to us at the Mandarin just a few blocks away, also supposedly one of the best chains in the world. It was a rip off from the beginning. I booked a rate at their Internet site and they refused to acknowledge it charging me their top fees. Our room stayed undone until five, room service was basically non-existent and guests had no access to the properties restaurants because they have them assigned to celebrities. Scape from South Beach and The Mandarin, go to the best, Four Seasons.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome”
Reviews.Author: Wats5
Reviews.Content: My stay at The Four Seasons, were beyond words, the staff were sooo helpful , from the beginning to the end, the hotel was not noisy, rowdy people were not in or around this hotel, just a beautiful place. ONE WORD " IMPECCABLE " from top to bottom. Can't wait to return. Thanks,staff and Sophia { Front desk, hope I'm spelling her name correctly} for making my husband's 50th Birthday a Success!!!

Reviews.Title: “Four Seasons/Five Stars!”
Reviews.Author: amarcoNYC
Reviews.Content: Amazing vues, location and pool area! Great and friendly service, fantastic breakfast!

Reviews.Title: “A Comfortable Oasis”
Reviews.Author: CUBUFF93
Reviews.Content: We loved this property. It is the little things that separate it from the pack. Touches like the elegant way the maid folded my shirts in the bathroom, the car valet who would always have our car ready and staff which were always helpful with directions. The staff meets you as you enter for the first time, riding with you to the front desk located on the seventh floor. It also doesn't hurt having a superior restaurant on property. Cons: The hotel does not have a coffee maker in the room and stops serving coffee in the lobby at 8 am. This forced me to ask for a cup from the host at the restaurant who acted like it would be free but ended up charging almost $5

Reviews.Title: “quiet luxury in a busy city”
Reviews.Author: tropicaltraveladdict
Reviews.Content: This was my first time at the Four Seasons in Brickell and we were impressed. The location is amazing for those on business or those who are looking to escape South Beach crowds and spring break parties. We loved everything about the hotel. The rooms were spacious and lovely, also most importantly VERY CLEAN. Ask for a corner room, we had 6 windows and partial bay and full city views. It was amazing and very relaxing. The pool area (where we spent 4 days) was a tropical oasis. Everything about the place was luxurious and calm. What you would expect from a four seasons for sure. The staff throughout the hotel were wonderful, but the pool staff really went out of their way to make you feel at home. They were so attentive and even brought us treats like watermelon smoothies, water with fresh fruit and cold towels for our faces and feet. It was great! the food is also wonderful and we would recommend the fish tacos and guacamole by the pool. They will also make you any kind of smoothie you would like as well. The staff at the front desk and concierge were also great. I can't say enough nice things about every staff member we encountered. The valet and doormen were spectacular. Everyone greeted you with a smile, made wonderful recommendations on places to go, and were attentive to every need. We even had complimentary mojitos to the room no our 4th night as it was one of my friend's birthdays. Such an awesome hotel and we can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “sumptious surroundings and service”
Reviews.Author: DublinDavy
Reviews.Content: a beautifully located hotel offering a high level of service. very helpful staff and a high standard of personal attention makes for a very pleasant experience.the quality/variety of cuisine is also to be complimented. cannot wait to return.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Restaurant Happy Hour”
Reviews.Author: WatsonTravellers
Reviews.Content: Saturday, January 28, 2012Bar Review: Edge at the Four Seasons In an effort to be nasty or depressing, several people told us web we moved to Miami that we would miss the seasons. I assume they meant the Four Seasons, because it's been 12 hours and I already do. Thank God it's just across the street. We tried Edge, the Four Seasons' newly opened steakhouse last night for happy hour. The experience was perfection. All other restaurants take notes. Having never been to any Four Seasons, I was very excited to get dolled up and pretend to be fancy while secretly looking for famous people. The lobby was gorgeous as any luxury hotel's is. Sleek and luxurious with a jewelry shop selling drool worthy baubles...for any season. Immediately, we were greeted by the entire team of the New York Knicks. Famous people count: very high. Could I identify any player? Of course not, but the fanciness factor was great. So we headed upstairs to floor seven where Edge has a beautiful, intimate indoor/outdoor set-up. The interior looked very much like the Viceroy. Plush with just the perfect amount of twist. Leather in colors that couldn't possibly occur in nature but were oh so chic. That sort of thing. We opted for seats at the bar for optimal people watching. Newbies to Miami take note of this happy hour. Two for one drinks. Any drink. This makes two glasses of Nicolas Feulliate $18 total or two cocktails $13 or two beers $6. They also offer oysters and marinated beef satay for $1. This happens from 3PM to 7PM everyday. At the Four Seasons. Wow! We opted just for drinks and the adorable baskets of homemade kettle chips they kept in front of you. Seen here. Thank you for reminding us they are fried, Four Seasons. Oh well, tiny things, even fryer baskets, are always cute and calorie free. Everyone knows this. So we're enjoying our drinks and who walks in but two old guys. Not just any old guys, famous old guys. Again, did I know this? Nope. But the spouse about fell out of chair. It was John Bolton, US ambassador to the UN during the last administration. Google images confirmed this! The excitement was contagious. I strongly encouraged spouse to ask John if he needed legal representation or at least for an autograph, but his martini wasn't working. The other old man had us furiously Google searching to figure out why Bolton was in town and who he might be. We never got a great view of his face though since his back was to us all night (rude!) It remains a mystery. Moral of the story, run to Edge! Now!

Reviews.Title: “awesome....”
Reviews.Author: 65sonu
Reviews.Content: the four seasons..miami is by far oneof the best hotels to be in miami....the hospitability...food...service is all uncomparable...will recommend it full....the awesome view...entry passes to nikkis beach is unforgettable.....

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant hotel, with a few details for improvement”
Reviews.Author: HPBKraaijeveld
Reviews.Content: Stayed here as a start of our cruise holiday in the Carribean. Genuine FS-hotel. Beautifull all the way, well kept but a true business hotel. Pity they got the dates wrong about my pre-booked SPA-services. Everyone can make mistakes but apologies in whatever way would have been appreciated. I missed a true service attitude, especially with the concierge service. But, beautifull hotel; very nice pool ans good pool-service. Good size room with a beautifull view. Breakfast and dinner were good, but not exceptional. Be awere of the fact that the hotel is located in the not that interesting business district of Miami. All in all a fine FS-hotel, though I have experienced better ones.

Reviews.Title: “Tis' The Season”
Reviews.Author: ExplorerPod
Reviews.Content: My recent stay at the Four Season's Miami was spectacular. Spacious rooms, amazing views and a fine staff all made my short stay in Miami a very rewarding experience. it's not a South Beach vibe, no its more than drunken madness on the beach. This is fine food, superior amenities and a break form everything Miami has become the past decade or so. The staff went out of there way to accommodate me and i found the meeting space more than adequate for small events up to 500-750 people. I also appreciated the free use of a computer to retrieve airline information and print boarding passes. The service at the pool was incredible, staff walked around tending to your every need and made sure we were well hydrated and catered to. The free smoothie samples, fruit punch and sunscreen completed the pool experience. yes- free sunblock. Again, this is not South beach, its quiet and removed from that.

Reviews.Title: “Improved but not cured”
Reviews.Author: ImpossiblyPicky
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in nov and am back in jan. Front desk is fixed, back to the opening team's standard that got raves from me. Restaurant remodeled? (hotel is new) and it's very chic. Food is very good and the space works as well at breakfast as at dinner. Service is fair however; they're stumbling over each other in there. valet is better, but some shifts aren't up to par (daytime's better than evening). Housekeeping isn't up to four seasons standards, a robe with a big stain, today no robes, a past guest's brazil nut on the floor when I arrived, soap at the sink none in the shower, and housekeeping on the phone is insolent and not accommodating (evening shift). And please kill the decorators upholstered pillow on the bed, everything else's washed for each guest who wants this piece of used upholstery plunked on your wonderful sheets (housekeeping can't answer how they're sanitized). I'm a loyal four seasons guest, Toronto if you can deliver in Timbuktu you can reign in miami. Pls, I come here often for business!!

Reviews.Title: “This is a genuine five star hotel”
Reviews.Author: WestMidlandsWoolfy
Reviews.Content: Boked three nights over New year in a premier bay view room, the first time we have stayed at a five star hotel and found no faults what so ever.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel but Something is Missing”
Reviews.Author: Becky33
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel compared to others, but only average by a Four Seasons standard. We stayed here for 4 nights prior to going on a cruise out of Miami. I had previously been in contact with the concierge to make arrangements for a robe and slippers for our 8yr old son. Anyone who has stayed at any Four Seasons knows that they ask for that information because they like to make your children feel special. When we got there it was not done. I thought because we had an upgrade perhaps it would come later, it did not. I made a call to concierge and was told they do not do anything for children at this hotel... Very odd. I called back after about 5 minutes and had Robe, slippers and bath toys.. (my son too old for those plus we had no tub in our room) but it was amazing how suddenly these items were made available. Our room was very clean, but there was no information in the room at all about anything... So everything you wanted to know required a call to the front desk. Also on our first night we went our for dinner and back in the room at 9:30pm, no turndown... the next morning there was a slip of paper saying they came by at 9:45 but did not want to disturb....a bit late for turndown These seem like small annoyances but when you are paying the amounts per night that you do here everything should be taken care of. The pool area on the 7th floor was amazing. The pool and cabanas are wonderful and the service around the pool area was outstanding. The men and women who work in that area certainly go out of their way to make sure you are comfortable and want for nothing. Water spritzes on your face, cold frozen treats brought around... it truly was wonderful. There is also a shallow pool at the back of the area with palm trees and hammocks... very relaxing. The food in the restaurant was very good. We had a very nice dinner there one night. The other nights we ate at outside establishments. The Valet service and the people who work there really follow the Four Seasons profile. Welcoming you back, always a smile and a kind word. We did not find that from the front desk staff. We have stayed at many Four Seasons internationally and have never encountered any issues at all. Perhaps we can give them the benefit of the doubt, but going forward on my next trip to Miami, I will give another hotel a try...

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: Virtualadvisor
Reviews.Content: Went with the family for a few days. It was quite quiet (December). Reservations staff were extremely helpful finding 3 connecting rooms that suited us. I recommend making a telephone reservation. The showers were good. Ipod docks in rooms. Great view of the bay. Pool area pleasant although shallow pool with palm trees needs a re-surface as paint is flaking off the bottom. Door staff are very welcoming. Lack of general hotel info in rooms. 2 of the 3 computers in the business centre weren't working and the one that did wasn't linked to a printer. It didn't seem focused on business or families particularly. Handy for visiting Key Biscayne and not far from anywhere in a car. Needs some refining but we still enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Four Seasons, Miami”
Reviews.Author: lovefood51
Reviews.Content: We had a quick getaway to the Four Seasons Hotel, in Miami, in December. The surroundings and service were everything you would expect from a Four Seasons Hotel, and more. The hotel lobby is located on the 7th floor, above an office building in downtown Miami. We were escorted to the 7th floor by a delightful employee after leaving our car with valet. Our luggage arrived in our room even before we did, and we were given a "tour" of the room. The bedding was luxurious and comfortable. There was an amazing view of the bay and causeway, as well as a comfortable window seat from which to enjoy the view. The pool is huge and lovely and has multiple cabanas . In addition, there is an unusual area behind the pool that has hammocks swinging from plam trees and overhanging a shallow lake-like pool. We visited the new Edge Steakhouse in the lobby, and had a fabulous meal. The prices were fair and the service was friendly and extremely attentive. We plan to return to the hotel and restaurant very soon.

Reviews.Title: “Not what we expected from a Four Season”
Reviews.Author: loveroamin
Reviews.Content: We stayed here at the end of May 2011. I was prompted to write a review now as I am currently trying to find somewhere else to stay for our next trip, and was reminded just how lacking this hotel had been. We have stayed in several Four Seasons around the world, and look forward to the exceptional service that the brand offers. Unfortunately the FS Miami really let us down. I don't know whether we caught them at a time they were training staff for the summer rush, but everything was lacking. I stood alone at reception waiting to be served, whilst the receptionist berated the other receptionist (trainee?) for not answering the phone within 3 rings! Lucky they didn't notice the person at the desk! Getting someones attention in the restaurant, bar or poolside was a trick as well, most were too busy chatting to each other in Spanish to be bothered to notice you were there. I did fill in a customer survey at the time and made all these comments but heard nothing back from the FS, again, slightly disappointing. Oh well, on with my search for somewhere better for next time.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic hotel very reasonably priced for the 85m2 suite.food is exceptional rooms have great views definately 10/10.”
Reviews.Author: mwreed186403
Reviews.Content: This is a great city hotel.No beach but who needs one when everything else is so good.2 pools one for the kids suites are the best priced in miami for the size one thing that definately stands out is the service and exceptional food

Reviews.Title: “Exactly what you may expect from Four Seasons”
Reviews.Author: aaronmarko
Reviews.Content: Very comfortable rooms, great outdoor pool with a restaurant and a jacuzzi. Views are very nice. Try the bar on 7th floor and enjoy the breakfast outside. Treatments at the Spa are top!

Reviews.Title: “STAY HERE FOR THE SERVICE”
Reviews.Author: Lisa K
Reviews.Content: The Four Seasons Miami, located on Brickell, is about a $20 cab ride from South Beach. It is a great alternative to the beach crowds. I stayed here for 3 nights over New Years with my husband and 2 kids The service is first rate. The room is serviced 2-3 times per day and the staff at the pool anticipates every need. They offer complimentary frozen fruit, drink samples (both alcoholic and non) and snacks throughout the day. The hotel occupies floors in a high rise and the pool area can be found on the 7th floor. The bathrooms are spacious, with a separate tub and shower, as well as a separate toilet area. The only downside was that the beds were super small. We always travel with our kids so we book a double room which usually means 2 queen beds, but is sometimes 2 full beds. I can't even call these beds at the Four Seasons full size. They were somewhere between twin and full (which I can't say I have seen before). We are thin people and still had a hard time with 2 people per bed. I highly recommend this property, it's right up there with the best of the Four Seasons. Just beware of the beds if you are someone (or sleeping with someone) who likes to spread out!

Reviews.Title: “World class hospitality”
Reviews.Author: KhimLee
Reviews.Content: We have been to several Four Seasons around the world and this one stands out for its service and the general layout and feel. The gym is the best hotel gym I have used; hotel staff offered our two young kids toys when we arrived; personalized bath sponges for the kids left in the bath area; excellent service at every turn; the pleasure of staying in the tallest building in Miami, and the list of positives goes on. Couple of things to look out for - there is no direct access to the beach and the pool area can get congested.

Reviews.Title: “Excelent”
Reviews.Author: asouza001
Reviews.Content: Excelent hotel. Perfect room, service and food. Reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “Flawless”
Reviews.Author: AlejandroAlcaraz
Reviews.Content: We had three rooms at the Four Seasons Miami and we truly had an amazing time. The Hotel is in a great location on the Brickell Avenue, fifteen minutes away from any major interest spot from Miami Area, and away from the typical hassle of South Beach. They were extremely helpful on every request we had, for example we arranged an airport pick up with a big van due to being a large family and having a lot of luggage, we also requested the concierge to find some golf equipment for us and they even delivered it to our room in the next 2 hours. Breakfast at the hotel is delicious, the staff is very kind, we had the same breakfast table for the entire stay which added to the personal touch and home feeling. The Gym facility and the Pool Area are top notch (one of the best fitness centers in Miami). The rooms we had were all renovated and the beds were very comfortable to sleep in. Bathrooms were very spacious and luxurious. All in all the Hotel offers you comfort of stay and a friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “AWESOME!!”
Reviews.Author: SARAH W
Reviews.Content: First ,of all ,the staff is second to none, impeccable Hotel, from the Valet to the Room Attendants, Clean,clean,clean. The pool area is Awesome, we just hung around because of the atmosphere. WILL RETURN !!! Thanks ,Sophia { Front desk },you made my Husband 50th ,so memorable. WE LOVE YOU ,FOUR SEASONS!!!

Reviews.Title: “the quality of the staff and the general condition of this hotel made our stay unforgetable !”
Reviews.Author: guillaume p
Reviews.Content: what did impress us the most has been the quality of the service and of the staff, then the room was perfect , even for the 4 of us , the bathroom perfect, the cleanest possible. Only dreaming getting back there !

Reviews.Title: “Not A 5 Star Hotel”
Reviews.Author: GOTSPF
Reviews.Content: I went to the Four Seasons a few weeks ago.... lobby was nice but furniture was generic... the patio outside the restaurant needs some landscaping... the pool and it's furniture needs to be addressed as well. Getting some sun by the pool is difficult since most chairs are blocked by palm trees. The rooms appeared like they might have been "upscale" and one point but the furniture once again was generic. On the upside... the service was great and the staff in the dining room at night bent over backwards to find the right wine by the glass for me!!!! I didn't get a "Miami Feel" I could have been at a hotel in mid town Manhattan or Chicago if it wasn't for the palm trees by the pool. Not a REAL Four Seasons.... too bad.

Reviews.Title: “All Business”
Reviews.Author: VoxVolpe
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful hotel with typical wonderful Four Seasons service and quality. I enjoyed staying here for business and that is one item to point out, this is a business hotel in the financial district and not what I expected from a Miami hotel. Again I was on business so it did not matter not having a beach or a active area but be aware that this is a true business hotel. Saying that everything was perfect and my room was very nice with a great view. Room service breakfast was on time and excellent and the staff were all very helpful and friendly. The design was pleasing and the bar and restaurant were both welcoming with excellent food. Four Seasons knows service and quality and you will find both in the business hotel.

Reviews.Title: “I could live in the hotel quite happily!”
Reviews.Author: hatch82
Reviews.Content: I was on a business trip to Miami for 4 days and stayed in the Four Seasons for my company's annual sales conference. The service was brilliant, the pools, rooms bar...everything was beautiful, clean and welcoming. My only down-side to the hotel is that they charge a fortune for drinks. I typically don't drink alcohol but charging roughly $5-6 dollars for a normal size can of Red Bull is ridiculous. All in all I had a brilliant stay and would happily go back again and again.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at Four Seasons Hotel Miami”
Reviews.Author: Mark H
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Four Seasons for a business trip. The hotel was well maintained - recently refurbished -- I was told. The staff were extremely friendly and helpful. Outstanding stay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service , great location with superb facilities , perfect for miami”
Reviews.Author: LightblueCambridge
Reviews.Content: We had a two night stay at the hotel , the location is ideal for Miami , the gym facilities are superb. The view from our room was breath taking . Highly recommend this wonderful hotel .

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel (even for families)”
Reviews.Author: JSNPN
Reviews.Content: Although this is more of a business hotel, we stayed for 3 nights with our 16 month old daughter prior to boarding a cruise and it worked very well for us. Because we were there over a weekend, the hotel was pretty quiet. The rooms are a good size and a high quality crib was provided which fit perfectly in a corner of the room. They also provided toiletries for my daughter and a cute little teddy bear (which my daughter loves and still plays with). Would have gotten 5 stars if wifi was complimentary (at US$12.50 a night it was pretty pricey). Valet was pricey ($34/night) but convenient given how many times we came in and out of the property and the valet guys were always very helpful with our stroller and our bags. Did not eat on site and instead had breakast twice next door at the Deli Lane Cafe which had a great selection of food. Was not as personalized as other Four Seasons properties (i.e. we were never referred to by name) but staff were always all smiles. Biscayne Boulevard is not the place to stay if you want to be in the middle of the action but for a family it was convenient and quiet. Got a great hotel + rental car deal through Expedia which came out to US$172 incl tax/night for both the room and the car!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Miami hotel for business or pleasure”
Reviews.Author: TM99
Reviews.Content: We travelled as a family to this FS in April 2011 and we greatly enjoyed our stay. It does have a "business" feel about it (and is located in the business district of Miami) but it is an excellent hotel and a perfectly good location for holiday-makers too. The pool is probably the best city-hotel pool I have ever used. Very large, well -landscaped with good and active service. Our suite was well appointed with the usual excellent FS bathroom. We were on a very high floor wioth a great view of the skyline - especially at night. The hotel is extremely well-kept - it's almost glossy in its sparkling cleanliness - and the service was consistent, low-key but very focused on the guest. When I return to Miami I will choose to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING STAY-TRULY FIVE STARS *****!!! I thought Customer Service was dead..it's just been hiding at the Four Seasons!”
Reviews.Author: NY_ShoeGirl
Reviews.Content: I LOVED the Four Seasons Miami! You need not read any further. I am the pickiest person alive and I've stayed at every chain imaginable but, the Four Seasons lives up to it's name and reputation! The service from time you check in is amazing. The reception was perfect and the hotel is gorgeous and clean. Keep your sweaters or pashmina for walking around or dinging in the hotel as the AC is always on HIGH! The staff was so friendly and first class from start to finish. The Room-AMAZING, cleaned daily (smelled amazing when you walked in), plush robes, plush slippers, a scale, private toilet, separate shower from a soak tub. Just GORGEOUS! The bed made me look forward to going to sleep at night, it was so cozy. The view from the bedroom was great. I loved that there was a doorbell, a long hallway, a living room with another sitting window with a great view. I can't say enough. The Mini-Bar-Not so mini-it had everything you could think you would want! Top shelf vodka, redbull, wine, juices, etc. Just top shelf. Candy, chips, gummy bears, nicely stocked from top to bottom. No it's not cheap but it's about what you would pay for a drink at a high end bar/restaurant. When I stayed at the Westin they offered an empty fridge...just horrible! The Epic didn't have on eat all.... The Hotel Bar-Be sure you ask the bartender if they know how to make certain drinks. They seem to be well versed in some but, not all. The bar is beautiful right next to pool. They even have a waterfall you can sit in while having your drinks. Just truly amazing! The Pool-GORGEOUS and great for lounging. The Spa Boutique-very nice unique jewelry, clothing (if you're the size 4 everyone in Miami is), great products and friendly staff. I bought a great back for a little over $100 by Budha...very nice! The Hotel Shop-great items, great jewelry, magazines, perfume, clothing, bathing suits (Trina Turk). The Sports Club LA-if you know this chain then you don't need to ask...GREAT! The Parking-very organized but, I suggest calling for your car at least 10 mins before you head down so you won't have to wait. (I'm not the most patient person). :-) There is no other place to stay in downtown Miami! The drive to SOBE is so quick and easy. Enjoy your stay...I did! ;-)

Reviews.Title: “Extremely clean and employes very helphull”
Reviews.Author: Federico R
Reviews.Content: It was a very good experience.! My family and I enjoy his quality, my wife and my son went to the pool twice. waiters at restaurant very good.

Reviews.Title: “Good but not perfect”
Reviews.Author: rajesh-boston
Reviews.Content: Hotel situated in the Finacial District, it's a good location for those not interested in beaches. It is one block to the free metro-mover monorail, which can take you to many points of interest in Miami. I stayed in executive suite with many useful services and amenities: safe (large enough for computer), DVD player, flat-screen TV, iron, mini-bar, but not a coffee-maker (why in a first class hotel like this one?). Bed was comfortable and room was quiet enough. Concierge service was excellent for recommendations on dining options and things to do. Pool was large included a hot tub and excellent pool attendant service. Towels and pad covers are provided. Too expensive parking.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely beautiful venue that overlooks the bay...”
Reviews.Author: T S
Reviews.Content: A wonderful venue close to the bay- I recommend a high floor suite so you can see the vistas. It is a bit pricey, and the hotel breakfast lineup, while adequate, is too expensive ($30/person) for my taste, but the accommodations more than made up for it. The staff is EXTREMELY attentive and I felt like I was the only customer in the entire hotel. Very well run establishment!

Reviews.Title: “Stunning hotel with excellent staff”
Reviews.Author: savvytraveller16
Reviews.Content: We arrived to this hotel from a 3 hour delayed flight from Las Vegas, so it was 1am when we arrived. The staff we just lovely and upgraded us to a 1 bedroom suite overlooking Biscayne Bay. The views were stunning and the decor of the room equally so. The rooms had so much light coming in but had full block out curtains for sleeping. The bathroom was beautifully equipped and had my favourite toiletries - L'Occitane! We had mineral water waiting with beautiful desserts compliments of management with a lovely personal note to enjoy our two day stay with them - and that we did. The king size bed was very comfortable, tv easy to use and for once their mini bar was not one of those ones where if you move something in it, it is recorded and charged to your room. It was simply a normal fridge. Lovely comfortable lounges and the decor was in chocolate, creams and greens. The bathroom was white with black accents. Breakfast was beautiful and had everything you could want and had excellent coffee as well. The surrounds were stylish and elegant and the pool with palm trees in it with hammocks hanging between them were so 'Miami' and allowed you to completely escape. We had lunch at the poolside restaurant and this was very good also - excellent mojitos and cold Coronas! The concierge, Jorge, managed to arrange for us to attend a college footbal match last minute and this was probably the highlight of our entire USA trip for my husband. If you get the chance you should go to a match and we have been told these matches are more theatrical than the NFL ones and it had the best atomosphere! Stephen at the front desk was so welcoming and did everything to make our stay one to remember. Isaac who delivered our luggage was equally so. These 2 guys deserve commendation. This hotel made us feel like we had a home away from home and the staff were all so accommodating and efficient. We thoroughly enjoyed this hotel and will recommend it to anyone visiting Miami.

Reviews.Title: “Miami Short Break”
Reviews.Author: RealHoop
Reviews.Content: Very good hotel with attentive staff, friendly and professional. Great views from the bay view rooms. Pool area is great and the hammocks excellent. Although this is in the Business District we preferred this to South Beach area. Go to the Mary Brickell Village a 12 minute walk from the hotel. Highly recommend Perricone's Italian. If there is a queue, queue, its worth it. Tip from my wife, don't eat the Serano peppers whole in the mexican!! For breakfast, miss the hotel and walk over the road to the French Bakery, La Provence Artisanal. If your golfers ignore Doral and play Crandon Golf Club at Key Biscayne, the hardest course you will ever play. 10 minutes and $20 in a cab.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet retreat”
Reviews.Author: westiemen
Reviews.Content: We have stayed twice at this beautiful property. The pool area is by far its greatest asset with it 's palm treed wading pool, no charge cabanas and freindly service. We have stayed in both the bay view king and the city view king rooms and our preferece is the city view which also has a partial bay view which makes it perfect. The hotel is well appointed and the loction is handy for hopping the metro to Corale Gables. Mary Brickell Village is near by with diverse dining options. Publix is in the rear of the complex with great selection of wines and food. We have always found the staff freindly and helpful and enjoy starting our winter break here before heading over to our stay in South Beach.

Reviews.Title: “Very good quality hotel”
Reviews.Author: ladydLancashire
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in august of this year with my husband. The hotel is located in the business district but we had a car so access to south beach was not a problem. The hotel is immaculate but with it being in the business district it does have a businessy vibe to it rather than a holiday feel. It is quite a trek from the car park to the hotel as the building houses banks and other businesses as well as the hotel. The reception staff were welcoming although we were not offered any help with our luggage upon check in. This was quite disappointing for a five star hotel. The man that showed us to our room was more concerned with trying to sell a suite upgrade to us rather than assisting with our luggage! Our room was clean and spacious with all the amenities we could need. The bed was very comfortable and the decor was elegant and simple. The pool area was clean and comfortable with a good bar and snack menu. Considering we were in the centre of the city, the pool area was tranquil and relaxing. Other than the odd snack, we did not eat in the hotel as we spent most evening out exploring the city. We found that the car parking charges were expensive and unnecessary. I do think hotel guests should be given a discount. Expect to pay in excess of $30 to park a car overnight. We were also surprised to find that we had to pay extra for use of the Internet. Considering the class of hotel we were in, this also seemed unreasonable. Overall, a good hotel but quite impersonal.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome !! Highly recommend ;)”
Reviews.Author: Gabbygirl77
Reviews.Content: Great hotel to feel very pampered and relax . Recommend a bay view room ;)

Reviews.Title: “Expected Four Seasons Quality”
Reviews.Author: JoseLuisContreras
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, room location and excellent gym. Had room service a couple of pints and was disappointed with all of the extra charges this 'service' has. So, beware of that. Otherwise great,

Reviews.Title: “Great For Adults!!”
Reviews.Author: surfsideMichigan
Reviews.Content: I decided to meet my family half-way between our respective homes and chose Miami, in particular the Four Seasons Hotel. This was to be a "Girls Only" meeting and a bit of luxury was called for! We were not disappointed - the hotel was beautiful and very well staffed although one really needs to know a little Spanish to feel they are truly getting through at times. The rooms were gorgeous, nicer even than the pictures, and housekeeping was impeccable. This is not a hotel for small children although on the Saturday they appeared out of nowhere to play in the pool. I never saw small children anywhere else so assume they were not hotel guests although the pool staff ARE vigilant about checking room numbers when you arrive. Service at the pool was great but be forewarned that the food was a disappointment - quite bland in my opinion. Breakfast was lovely and we ate out every night so did not try the dining room for dinner. the hotel is located around the corner from Mary Brickell Village where we found lots of restaurants. The biggest selling point for the Four Seasons was the PRICE - yes, the price! It was quite steep, but with every third consecutive night free we decided it was worth it and booked ourselves in. Smart Marketing!

Reviews.Title: “WE LOVED IT CANT WAIT TO GO BACK”
Reviews.Author: juliepanebianco
Reviews.Content: Great & relaxing --close to many excellent restaurants and South Beach without madness

Reviews.Title: “luxury in the city”
Reviews.Author: ZETA333
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at this property for our summer vacation. It is located in the business district of Miami away from the hustle and bustle of Miami Beach. It's location is an easy drive to Bayside Mall, the AA arena and the bridge to Miami Beach. One drawback is that it occupies several floors in a high-rise building that it shares with condos. Therefore, you have to take 2 elevators from the street level to reach your room. The pool area was amazing. The hotel has a separate pool for its guests. They even provide suntan lotion, sun block and fruit infused water complimentary. Towels are ample and the hotel will allow you to take them to the beach. The suite was roomy and comfy. Room service quick and accomodating. One special treat was seeing the Dallas Maverick up close and personal as they were also staying at this hotel

Reviews.Title: “I wish i hadn't left.”
Reviews.Author: zinse24
Reviews.Content: I am writing this review so people understand of the value you get with the Four Season Miami. I travel a lot for work. This time I was with my wife. Let's begin with the room. The room was super nice, big, conformable, and super CLEAN. Let me tell you they clean the room twice a day. The bedding is superb, so comfortable, so soft. I'm used 5star hotels. This one blew me away. The pool is always clean and super. Nice. It's in the seventh floor so you don't hear the croud or the noise for the street. The pool rest was open daily til 6 I think it should stay open later but no worries because there's a million restaurant within walking distance. The concierge please use them. They were great. They help us get to South Beach inform us where to go and where to spend the day. Ask them about their connections with the Nikki Beach Club. They will make you happy. No need to rent a car. Take a taxi and just walk Pr rent a bike for the day. Ask them about Lincold RD. They were really helpful. The breakfast was great but EXPENSIVE. Ask then about the good spot they don't mind. All I can say if you choose to stay here you will feel like realty. Have fun and enjoy.

Reviews.Title: “It blew us away”
Reviews.Author: HRHalac
Reviews.Content: We were returning from a 5 day stay in Saint Barth's and were delayed leaving the Caribbean due to Hurricane Irene. We had to overnight an additional night in Saint Maarten before finally landing in Miami, the overnight at the Four Seasons was always planned as part of our trip, we were able to change dates without problems and check in seamlessly when we arrived. I booked through American Express Platinum and we were upgraded to a corner suite that really left us speechless for a few seconds. The color scheme in soft greens and the light color of the furniture make up for a really soothing environment. That room was wonderful to walk in to. And we had stayed at an ultra luxury boutique hotel in Saint Barth's, we thought it would have been a tough act to follow. Aside from that, the lobby of the hotel is grand. The signature room scent they use is fresh without being overpowering and I could not find a speck of dust on any surface. Our check in did not take more than 3 minutes, they are really quick and very courteous. We dined at the bar, the food took a bit longer than expected but it was very well prepared and presented, the service was discrete and unobtrusive, not in-your-face. The bed was so comfortable and soft, I don't remember anything else after I laid my head down, I have troubles falling asleep but in that bed it seemed I fell asleep faster than usual. We were impressed with the quality of the food, the level of service, how clean everything was and the refined luxury of this hotel, a stark contrast with other luxury hotels in Miami that are perhaps a bit over the top. It is not located in SoBe which may be a drag for those seeking the nightlife and restaurants there, however having lived in SoBe for 3 years and being now a frequent visitor, I think I have found a new place to stay, I would not care that it's not at the beach, and if I want to plan a beach day, I would drive to it but then return to the comfort and good food of this hotel. It really beats any of the hotels I have stayed at in SoBe, worth the distance. I did some research about where to stay that night returning from Saint Barth's because I wanted to close the vacation with something special, it was a trip to celebrate my 40th birthday. The Four Seasons Miami surpassed all my expectations.

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel without beach in Miami”
Reviews.Author: xxxx73
Reviews.Content: Since your arrival at the Vallet you will feel the difference, very nice people, always looking for your comfort. The rooms are vey spacious and the beds and bed clothes are great. I will stay there every time I'm in Miami!

Reviews.Title: “A great place”
Reviews.Author: mark7856
Reviews.Content: Took the family for a vacation. Facility and service was excellent. Front desk staff was superior. The fitness club was so convenient and truly first class. Not on the beach but convenient for restaurants, many within 3-4 blocks.

Reviews.Title: “I would recommend this to anyone going to Miami for vacation. The staff here gave my girlfriend and I A service.”
Reviews.Author: Amado B
Reviews.Content: This hotel was great. Would definitely stay here again. Staff treated my girlfriend and I as though we were celebrities. Could not have asked for more. Thanks Four Seasons Hotel staff for the wonderful service!

Reviews.Title: “really great service and facilities, breakfast really superb”
Reviews.Author: JJN300603
Reviews.Content: the same superb level that the Four Seasons is recognised for world wide .. lovely pool facilities, wonderful service .. worth a visit if in Miami ..

Reviews.Title: “Five Star Hardware, You Pay For Just A Name”
Reviews.Author: malioil
Reviews.Content: The Four Seasons Miami wasn't terrible, as the star rating may suggest. It just didn't add up to the experience one expects from Four Seasons. As always with hotels of this high rung, it isn't the basics that matter, but rather, the details, and that is where the hotel didn't excel. It was adequate, but at this level, adequate is just not enough. Yes, it's exclusive- the rates make sure of that. For a hotel located in downtown (which is a terrible location- you need a taxi to get to absolutely everything a tourist might want to get to, I would not recommend this location if you are a leisure traveler at all), but that's all. I had a Bed & Breakfast package, which meant I had $55 credited to spend on breakfast every morning- we were three people, and breakfast usually ran $91 without purchasing anything extra. The food itself was very good, an acceptable selection and brilliant taste. The staff at the restaurant too were quite willing, and did accommodate orders that were not on the menu (for example, fresh papaya juice). I stayed in an Executive Suite, and the room itself was large, with a separate bathroom for guests, plenty of storage space, a brilliant lie mat on the window ledge, a good view and a very comfortable bed. For a city hotel, the swimming pool is vast, beautiful, and clean. The pool side service was really great, sun screen and beverages provided, as well as pool toys. Looking out from the pool, you'd think your in a resort, not a downtown property. So what is my main quibble then? At Four Seasons, it just happens that other than great, solid hardware, and relatively good service in the public areas, you except staff to go further- not to fly, but you need not order slippers, ask for a third bed to be made at midnight when you already informed the front office earlier, have the coffee making machine taken away even though you have made it clear to housekeeping that you want it to stay in the suite, then it takes two hours for them to bring it back to the suite. Throughout, the service was reactive, not proactive. The staff didn't anticipate your needs, you told them, then you told them again. You even have to hang a notice on your door to receive a newspaper. Perhaps this may seem like a rather small quibble to warrant such a low rating. Yet at this rate (both figuratively and financially) if its not the excellent, then its not good enough- there is somewhere else your $500+ a night can go. Overall, the hotel wasn't bad- a less-than-excellent Four Seasons is still probably better than most hotels, but in my experience, the Ritz-Carlton South Beach (or any of the near by Ritz-Carltons) would probably be a better choice. Also, upon check-in should the front desk ask you to ''move to a more comfortable'' room, do ask to see both rooms, or just stick to the one you took instead of grab the upsell- and to be honest, such standard upsells to all guests (I heard it be done three times) as is on the Four Seasons website isn't something you'd expect from the world's foremost hotel chain.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great service, super comfy beds!”
Reviews.Author: trvlchnl
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 1 night in July for a party there. The service is fantastic at this property. We were upgraded due to AMEX platinum card and had all amenities. the room was really nice, newly renovated and the bathroom was great. The bed was very comfortable and all was flawless. Worth the price!

Reviews.Title: “Flawless Service!”
Reviews.Author: ko0kla
Reviews.Content: I was very impressed with this beautiful property and it's rich decor, luxury, cleanliness, level of service from Daniel Miraval (Front Office Manager) & Ankur Lakhani (concierge) was absolutely wonderful. They were very hospitable, friendly, and attentive. This is easily the most personal & impressive hotel experience I have ever had the pleasure of indulging in. The rooms are quiet, spacious and immaculately presented. Overall, this is avery classy hotel in a great location with flawless service!

Reviews.Title: “Far exceeded my expectations...really spend some time here”
Reviews.Author: schellgirl
Reviews.Content: My 14-year old daughter and I stayed at the FS Miami during a layover before a mission trip to the Dominican Republic (I know...the irony was not lost on us, either). Unfortunately, we arrived late and had to leave early the next day. The pool area is spectacular. My daughter and I loved swinging in the hammock and watching the stars. This is an AMEX FHR hotel and we were given a $100 food and beverage credit - excellent room service meal served poolside. The staff went all out for my daughter. She collects rubber ducks and they had them everywhere. A room service tray was brought up with a rubber duck motif and about 5 fabulous desserts all "swimming" on a blue sugar pond. As we checked out, the concierge and reception staff all asked Jess whether she had enjoyed her treat...she sure had. Indicative of the fabulous service Four Seasons is known for. Oh, and the bed was extremely comfortable...particularly nice given that my daughter had a fever and bronchitis. I also found the rate to be very reasonable for a FS.

Reviews.Title: “WOW, Amazing Hotel”
Reviews.Author: colony
Reviews.Content: Here you get everything - great hotel, great location, great food, great people to deal with! The view from the my hotel room was breathtaking! Staff was courteous and very efficient. Had a dinner and breakfast and food was great. I loved the window seat in my room that overlooked the bay. Bathroom for a woman traveler was excellent and well appointed.

Reviews.Title: “A fantastic hotel! The service was outstanding!”
Reviews.Author: Ole1981
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for 7 nights (5 adults + 1 child). The food in the restaurant was very good and we had all our breakfasts there and most of our dinners in the hotel. The facilities was very modern and nice, and you feel very relaxed. The employees were very service minded and the the concierge service helped us very much picking the right activities in the city. Nice swimming pool.

Reviews.Title: “We LOve it”
Reviews.Author: avic26
Reviews.Content: The Four Seasons treated us like Kings and Queens, love every night we were there. Will be back next year.

Reviews.Title: “Four Seasons Miami is an excellent hotel with impeccable service and an unparalleled staff. I can't give enough praise.”
Reviews.Author: JGNA11
Reviews.Content: Form the front desk, to room service to concierge, everyone went out of their way to meet our needs and wants. Helpful and courteous, but non-intrusive, describes the staff. The suite was spacious with a spectacular view. The concierge went above and beyond to assist us. The stay was a vacation in and of itself.

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENT HOTEL, SERVICE, LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: Andrew196511
Reviews.Content: Just spent three days there with my family and we had a great time. From the moment we checked in, we were treated very special and the staff went beyond the limit to make us feel at home. The Concierge were very helpful, the House keeping were superb. Not forgetting to mention the pool, AMAZING. If you have a chance to be in Miami, you need to treat yourself and stay at this Four Seasons. Andrew

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!!! Great hotel and great service.. If you are looking for a detail-oriented staff this is the place to stay!!!”
Reviews.Author: MarieChantell
Reviews.Content: Excellent!!! Great hotel and great service.. If you are looking for a detail-oriented staff this is the place to stay!!! I stayed here to celebrate my birthday with my girlfriends and I found the hotel to be perfect for any special occasion... The concierge staff is absolutely amazing... Great job Four Seasons :)

Reviews.Title: “good location”
Reviews.Author: sugar_pepsi
Reviews.Content: We had the pleasure to enjoy the transfer offered by the FS upon our arrival at the Miami's aiport to the hotel. On our arrival we were accompanied to the reception located at the 7th floor of this business building; very quickly we were in our room located at the 28th floor. The room had a fantastic view to the Key Biscane. The room was well furnished with the tipical FS touch! You can enjoy your breakfast inside or on the terrace near the pool. The FS is located in Downtown, you can reach a lot of good restaurants by walking or, if you have a car, you can drive without problems to the different parts of Miami. A business hotel with the tipical FS charme! We will certainly return soon.

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms, great management and great staff for every need!”
Reviews.Author: BJII
Reviews.Content: We loved it! You cannot beat the service and rooms of this city hotel. Check it out.

Reviews.Title: “we love it”
Reviews.Author: SelenaLiu
Reviews.Content: hotel staffs are all friendly and helpful. The bed is very comfortable. but i would hope they provide free internet, that would be great.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Ccurly55
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel with amazing pool area. Only downfall is location from the beach.

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms - but a lot of small things do not add up”
Reviews.Author: WisemanGunter
Reviews.Content: On arrival we were excited about the hotel because they gave us an upgrade to a wonderful suite (due to a special program, though, we are entitled to upgrades). The reception staff was very nice and friendly. But then the small things did not add up at all: in a huge suite we could not even find a simple coffee maker; the restaurant and other areas were so cold that a lot of people put on jackets and sweaters (which is a shame because everywhere they talk about "environmental friendly blah blah"); and the real joke was the price for the parking: 36, yes 36 USD per night! This is just ridicudulous. And then, at check out, they forgot a 100USD credit we had, only after asking for it they started calculating how much of it we would get. So service rating: perfect at check-in, poor at check-out. This is absolutely unacceptable and not first-class at all. My suggestion: go to the Conrad instead which is just a few steps away.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel in Miami”
Reviews.Author: rosenblumtv
Reviews.Content: After years of searching for a good Miami hotel, and coming close with the new Mandarin Oriental, this finally solves the problem of where to stay. Great rooms and fantastic staff.

Reviews.Title: “Good - But not as good as some”
Reviews.Author: Jo D
Reviews.Content: My wife and I chose to finish our honeymoon by staying at the Four Season Hotel in Miami, now having stayed at a number of Four Seasons Hotels before, we were sure this would be a great end to a magical honeymoon. Having ended our cruise in Fort Lauderdale, we picked up our rental car and drove to Miami; upon arrival at the valet I was a little disappointed to be asked "Who are you here to see sir?" OK, Alamo did do us a disservice and provided us with a Kia 4x4, but still it's a little rude to assume you're not staying at the hotel just because you're driving a KIA! We then arrived at reception, as we were a little early, even though we'd asked for an early check-in, we were informed that our room would be an hour or so until it was ready. We were informed that we could go and grab a drink at the pool bar whilst we waited, but in fairness the atmosphere was not very friendly at all. I asked if there was another room which we could have, only to be told that the hotel was at capacity, and the only other room available was a suite, which we'd have to pay an additional $200 to upgrade to. As we were on honeymoon we thought we'd upgrade despite the additional cost. Once we'd finished checking in and paid for our upgrade we were told the room wouldn't be ready of an hour or so either, I was a little surprised as the whole reason for the upgrade was to avoid waiting. We proceeded to the pool bar, to get a drink whilst our suite was being cleaned, the pool area is nice, but doesn't compare to the Four Season Hampshire or Sharm El Sheikh. Our waitress was quite off with us, and made us feel as if we were bothering her, which is not the kind of service you expect from this hotel group. After well over any hour we were shown to our room, this was very nice indeed, but didn't feel as well appointed as other rooms in the hotel group. After a dip in the pool we decided to head into Miami for some dinner, and asked one of the concierge team to recommend somewhere for dinner, the recommendation was an excellent and dinner was lovely. The next morning we ordered some breakfast from the room service menu, only to find the $55 allowance (which is part of the bed and breakfast package) was bordering on the ridiculous, and if you wanted a decent breakfast you'd need to spend at least another $20 on top, petty I know, but when you're spending $900 a night on a room, you'd expect breakfast would be included, and not limited to a certain figure (which is not a realistic one at that). Having requested a late check-out we were annoyed to be called at 12pm on the dot, and asked if we needed any help with our luggage, in other words "can you please leave now" I explained we'd requested a late check-out, only to be told that wasn't possible, but if we wanted to pay for another night we could leave as late as we wanted. So it wasn't a case of we don't have the room, it was a case of weâ€™re not prepared to give you a free late check-out! Unfortunately we found the hotel to be a disappointment, yes it is a lovely hotel, and in a great location, but the service leaves a lot to be desired. I strongly suggest that the Four Seasons Miami send their staff to be trained under Charlie Parker at the Four Seasons Hampshire, or Oliver Bruns at the Four Seasons Sharm El Sheikh. One further disappointment before I end my review, about a week after our return to the UK, we received a questionnaire via email, asking us to give feedback on our recent stay, I filled the questionnaire in, and provided plenty of detail around the issues weâ€™d experienced with a hotel of this calibre, and was asked to provide a telephone number so the hotel manager could contact me personally, well, 8 months on I am still waiting for that telephone callâ€¦

Reviews.Title: “A decent experience”
Reviews.Author: Alok42
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on a Holiday with family. The staff was very warm and welcoming. Rooms were decent. This was our first stay at a Four Seasons property. Therefore we were disappointed to note every basic amenity was missing. No Coffee Maker, No bottled water high parking charges and Internet charges were also steep. For a holiday, this is not the best location as it is located in downtown. South Beach is far away and should be the place to stay. Service was very good and people were very warm. The pool was also amazing. Overall a decent experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great short stay at the Four Seasons”
Reviews.Author: NYCArriviste
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent one night in Miami after vacationing in the Keys and we were not disappointed with the Four Seasons. Upon check in we were greeted with smiles and were informed that had been selected for an upgrade to a suite - which was terrific. Great view, great pool, great food. But most of all it was the fantastic service that sets this hotel apart and makes you feel special.

Reviews.Title: “Good pool area, good restaurant, but poor rooms”
Reviews.Author: 23Nomad
Reviews.Content: We spent four nights at this hotel. Before going, I did a lot of research and chose Four Seasons because of my previous good experiences with the brand, and a reasonable price at this time of the year. Good things: pool was excellent, much larger than Mandarin Oriental or hotels in Miami Beach. Service at the pool is great as well, and not as many people as in Setai, Mandarin Oriental, or other comparable hotels (we went there for meals and checked them out). The restaurant Aqua was the best service and food quality / price ratio for Miami. Try their daily specials. Service with parking and at the arrival is very good too. So make sure you come to Aqua even if you do not stay at this hotel. Bad things: the rooms and the service at the front desk were ok, just OK. That is, it was not Four Seasons, it was just one more OK five star hotel. They do not seem to understand their competition. Another problem is that there is only one restaurant at the hotel (Aqua). It is good, but it is not a five star hotel standard, especially in Miami. If you go to a gym, be aware that though the gym is large and has various equipment, it is dated and there is no exclusivity - it is not a Four Seasons gym, just as their spa is also in the office building and not part of the hotel. You are a kind of 'trapped' in the hotel because you have to change lifts to get out, to the ground level. Though they try to present it as a question of 'exclusivity,' it also means that there is no exclusivity, since you are sharing environment with office workers and everyone else all the time by changing lifts and not having a proper hotel entrance / lobby. There is not 'grand' lobby upon entering, like in most other Four Seasons - so do not expect the same level of 'wow' factor. In short, though we enjoyed some aspects of this hotel (pool area, the restaurant), on our next trip to Miami we will stay elsewhere, most probably in Mandarin Oriental, Setai, the Tides or Delano, where there is this 'wow' factor that this one does not have.

Reviews.Title: “Not a place to Relax”
Reviews.Author: lyyoung
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located on the top floor of a high rise office building in downtown miami. The view from the pool in skyscrapers and office buildings. The this hotel does not have a beach. You can drive 30 minutes to South Beach if you can find a public beach to access. Upon arrival, we realized we would never relax and get out of work mode so we decided to find another hotel. We never went into our room but simply told the front desk clerk that we were leaving. I called my travel agency and explained the situation. I was told they could refund my money less one nights charge if I got a letter from the hotel that they were only charging me for one night. The front desk manager told me he would not write anything down for me. I asked to speak to some one higher up but was told he was the highest at the hotel. I also asked if I could get a credit for another Four Seasons stay for my three nights and he told me no the hotels are not owned by the same company. We have stayed at other Four Seasons and never has such poor customer service.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Everything!”
Reviews.Author: CharmieC
Reviews.Content: This is my first time staying at the Four Seasons, and I must say, I was not disappointed. I love the uncrowded, tranquil ambiance the minute you stepped in the lobby. Staff was extremely helpful and friendly. My sister and I checked in rather late, and unfortunately the restaurant was closed. However, they were quick to recommend other places with late dining. The room was spacious, clean, and absolutely quiet. I had one of the best sleep ever in a hotel. And I woke up to a gorgeous view of the water. My favorite part is the location. It is away from the bustle and chaos of South Beach in a quiet and safe are of Brickell, but just a 10 minute cab ride to nightlife and restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with an awesome gym and pool”
Reviews.Author: DallasJD6189
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here a couple times over the past months. Rooms are really big and very comfortable. Very quiet and easy to sleep. Hardly heard a thing in the hall. The gym is one of the biggest gyms i have ever been to in a hotel. It is better than any Ballys or 24 Hour. The pool is pretty and big. Times i have been it was quiet and not filled with tourists. In general this hotel serves an upscale, professional guests. The room service is speedy and on time. Parking is a bit confusing and something that should be made easier. Otherwise this is a definite place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: j9999
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a wedding. The service was excellent. The rooms were comfortable and perfect. Very quiet. The party was excellent too. I is a perfect place to stay. If you want to be on the beach or near the nightlife, it really isn't the spot for you but if you want to relax and feel pampered, it is excellent. Do not hesitate to book your event here. It was the nicest I've ever been to. The only grip I would have is that it is $36 a night to valet park at the hotel. This is Miami, not NYC and that seemed to be a bit of a gouge. Other than that , it is amazing. You will be happy that you picked the four seasons.

Reviews.Title: “Wowed me with the little things!”
Reviews.Author: souzanyc
Reviews.Content: First of all, This hotel is not in South Beach. Major plus!!! Brickell is a upscale area with great restaurants, a grown up nightlife scene, and near great shopping. Whe I walked into the hotel at 1 am, I was offered water from the bellman. The Botero statues greet you inb the lobby, but when you get to the seventh floor- the magic begins. I was greeted by my name and with a genuine smile from the agent Reggie. I felt very welcomed, and he confirmed our reservations. I told him I needed a couple of days of sunshine and relaxation. He said and I quote " I see you are here for two days, Please let me know if there is anything we can do to make this the most pleasant stay here in Miami! Initially I was going to shorten my stay, because it seemed too costly. I had another reservation for two nights at another hotel . I came from a very cold NYC, and caught a cold. I was sniffling at the front desk, and without asking, a complimentary cup of tea was sent to my room! I called down and extended my stay after that! The hotel was packed, yet I felt like I was the most important guest. The bellman delivered my bags really quickly. The gym was great, but it wasn't 24 hrs. I really enjoyed the brunch, and the drinks poolside were to die for! In the morning, the concierge helped me finding a running path. Thgis was my third four seasons, and I think I am hooked for life.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury, Superb Service, Nice Views, Good Food, Nice Pool, Great Rooms, Not a Party”
Reviews.Author: ChetX5150
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed here for a long weekend in March to attend a music festival. Hotel was fairly busy, but rooms and common areas were comfortable and quiet. Rooms are new and nice, very upscale, great amenities and nice minibar. Many rooms have great views of water or city and hotel is very tall--higher rooms often have best view. Room service was very well prepared and good food. TV was nice. Lobby bar had nice drinks and restaurant is one of the best in town. Concierge desk often had THREE people, which is great. Location is downtown and a nice area--but a few blocks from the water. Main negative was that it was VERY hard to get a cab--even at the Valet station. They did not seem to have a contract with any town cars or car service either. It also has the lobby on the 7th floor, which means you can't get in and out of the hotel very quickly. But it is a solid FOUR SEASONS in every way. Great hotel, great service, great stay in Downtown Miami. If you want a party--GO TO SOUTH BEACH, but for business or a downtown stay--the Four Seasons is very worth it. Fitness Center is big and nice, but the third party who runs it was NOT up to Four Seasons service.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury, service, service and service”
Reviews.Author: Rick095
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for my wife's birthday weekend. We had to ask Tony Rodriguez for a favor (whose name I got from the trip advisor articles) to get a specific room. We purchased a one bedroom bay view suite. The rooom was spacious with 2 baths and tastefully appointed. There were teriffic views of the bay from three picture windows. We were greated by a staff who each wished my wife happy birthday. She received a cake as well as a complementary bottle of champagne in the room. Andres bought her champagne at the pool when he found out it was her birthday. At 9:30PM on Friday night we needed a day bed (my RLS was acting up) and within 10 minutes one was brought to the room complete with a mattress similar to the king and fully made up. The concierge was very attentive and made all of our reservations. When our limo was late for dinner the head valet called the desk and they informed the restaurant we were running late and to hold the table. The pool was very large and we were able to request a cabana which was first come no charge. The front desk was very helpful and called when our room was available. The fitness room was oneof the largest I have ever seen at a hotel. They had classes every hour from youga to spinning etc. This was a hotel amenity. This was a great experience and as I always say "you get what you pay for" Uncle Rick

Reviews.Title: “Would go back”
Reviews.Author: familyfour65
Reviews.Content: The hotel is awesome. We were comfortable and felt secure. This was spring break week, but we never saw large groups, so it was an oasis when we returned from being on the beach or shopping. We had a bay view room, which was fabulous. The only things I would have wanted different: we had to ask for bottled water, then they only left two small bottles for 4 people. Coffee service in the morning was not very good. They were either out of coffee or cups. They told me there was a place on the 3rd floor I could go get coffee on the go. FS pools usually have more amenities at the pool, like frozen fruit. One morning, the pool attendants didn't get water put ut for quite some time, then the sunscreen never appeared. Another guest mentioned this, and I heard the pool attendant tell him they didn't have as many people working there as they used to. Nonetheless, this is why we go to this level of hotel. Even with those small things missing, we would definitely go back. Housekeeping was imeccable. The l'occitane products sold me so much, I visited the local boutique in Miami and bought the same items to take home. Try the steam room. It was relaxing and a welcome retreat. Valet parking, even at $36, was always prompt, polite and we never waited on our car.

Reviews.Title: “Our Favorite Hotel in Miami --Absolute Oasis”
Reviews.Author: LadyLux123
Reviews.Content: I have been going to Miami every February for the past 13 years so I have stayed everywhere from the Mandarin Oriental to the Clevelander. The Four Seasons Miami is one of the best hotels in the world! You literally feel the calm and soothing tranquility from the moment you walk through the doors. The hotel ambiance is heavenly, the service impeccable, and the overall feel absolutely first class. Everything a 5 star hotel should be. We went to Miami last month, stayed at another hotel, and missed the Four Seasons the whole time! We missed the hotel so much that we took a cab over to have an outdoor lunch there. Oh those frozen Oreo drinks..yuumm The Zen like, tropical feel of the pool area...From here on in this is the only hotel we will ever stay in when visiting Miami.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel away from the crowds of South Beach”
Reviews.Author: josiegrammer
Reviews.Content: We travelled with our children both under age 10 so I was a little concerned initially that we should have stayed at the beach but we were very happy with our choice. The pool area at the hotel was really lovely and our kids swam all day long. The cabanas were a great place for lounging and getting out of the sun when they needed a rest. I liked that they were complimentary and also we never had any problem getting one no matter what time of the day we headed to the pool. The pool side service was a little spotty our first day - i just think it was pretty crowded that day. After that however, service was what you would expect from a FS. We had great food and drinks at the pool, loved Nancy the bartender who even took my son and let him serve himself some soft serve ice cream from the machine they had at the bar. The gym is actually a Sports Club LA so it is huge and has everything you would need, tons of classes etc. Concierge helped us with great restaurant recommendations that were kid friendly both nearby and in South Beach. Our room was maybe kind of sterile but it had tons of huge windows and window seats. We had a suite that was plenty big for a family of four. South Beach was about a 20 minute ($35) cab ride away and we did spend one morning at the beach which was nice. The concierge had given us details about parasailing and deep sea fishing - both of his recommendations there were great too. The kids had little treats left for them in the room a couple of nights, housekeeping great, etc. Really no complaints. Just what we were looking for.

Reviews.Title: “Weekend Getaway in a plush downtown location”
Reviews.Author: suzq22
Reviews.Content: Great location downtown in a business district that seems more like a business hotel. However we had a great weekend - the concierge recommended a local downtown restaurant on the water which was great. We also were able to catch dinner in south beach- a 20 minute cab away. The lobby was elegant, never more than a handful of people seen even though the hotel was pretty full. The room was spacious with great views. The bathroom was immaculate and elegant. The Pool area was lovely however there seemed to be at times hard to get poolchairs. The service there was good but I expected more in terms of pampering. The Concierge service was great and made several reservations and accomodations -- an excellent job. Overall a solid hotel in a business area close to all.

Reviews.Title: “Oasis downtown”
Reviews.Author: ohiorona
Reviews.Content: I was skeptical over some of the reviews I have read on this hotel. Service problems, dated interior etc. I must say although this is no resort hotel, it is up to Four Seasons standards. This is a hotel that begins on the 7th floor and it's not that hard to figure out. You walk in and someone tells you where to check in, not confusing in the least. I was checked in swiftly and taken to our room by the person checking us in.
