Miami in February is iffy and although we were from Ohio, it didn't matter we found that although not alot of activity, is what we wanted just R & R. If you are looking for nightlife, and hustle and bustle, I agree with other posts go the South Beach or Coconut Grove. This hotel though lets you get away from it all with style and service. The Acqua restaurant was excellent, and pool service very accomodating. It's not the beach, but it's a comfortable getaway. The only problem I found was the lack of taxi activity at the hotel. It took us a long time to get taxis and the general knowledge of the taxi drivers was amazingly bad.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel.”
Reviews.Author: craigspud101
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Four Seasons Miami for a bit of a break. It was everything I wanted it to be. It's not near any of the touristy parts of Miami but for me that was a good thing. I had some bad news whilst I was there and flew a member of my family out to join me. The staff were incredible during my 'bad time' (I was told over the phone by the pool that one of my dogs had been knocked over by a car. Consequently I burst into tears and it took me a while to recover. Sorry if your not a dog person but to me it's God spelt backwards.) Everything about the hotel surpassed my expectations and I'll be sure to stay next time I'm in Miami.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel experience I have ever had - never felt so pampered!”
Reviews.Author: ValorieLurry
Reviews.Content: We were recognized by name by the concierge, front desk, and valet. We were given the grand tour upon arrival and personally escorted to our rooms. Will definitely come back! Made me love Miami!

Reviews.Title: “Four Seasons Miami”
Reviews.Author: TheNetBuilder
Reviews.Content: Stayed on the 32nd floor and had a partial view of the bay and the city. Nice location, but is a 15 minute drive to the South Beach area. Hotel room was very nicely appointed and very clean. It is a bit confusing trying to determine where the hotel is, because it is part of a business complex. Service was very good and attentive. Enjoyed my stay! The pool area was also very nice...

Reviews.Title: “Where do I start?!”
Reviews.Author: tokyolady
Reviews.Content: My stay started off on a rocky start. I had the unfortunate experience of being placed next door to children who liked to ring my doorbell. I complained to security and his response was, "that's teenagers, for you." No. Not the response you expect when you pay $800.00 dollars/night for a junior suite. Also, a young concierge at the front desk had this to say about the situation, "You know we cannot control what other guests do at our hotel?" Unbelievable! This type of response would be unheard of at The Four Season Seattle which is why I will continue to stay there. I will not stay at the Miami Four Seasons hotel in the future. The valet service is terrible as well. If you ask the staff for a taxi with the place that you would like to go, be forewarned, they will not do this for you unless you have the EXACT address. This includes famous, well-known places in Miami such as Merrick village shopping plaza. The majority of taxi drivers in Miami are horrific. They are extremely rude, text and talk on their phones while driving. The taxi drivers in Miami are the worst drivers I have encountered anywhere in the world. ANYWHERE. The valet service at this hotel should be able to supply the drivers with the necessary information for their hotel guests. They are unwilling to do this. They need to be trained by the valet services at the Four Seasons in Seattle. The taxi drivers in Seattle are terrible as well but at least the staff at the Four Seasons Seattle are 'tip-top' and able and willing to help their guests with addresses. It appears that the majority of staff at the Four Seasons Miami have not been trained well, if at all. Most of them are surly, young, inexperienced young adults with terrible argumentative attitudes. The only reason that I continued my stay at this hotel and didn't go to the Mandarin Oriental was because of the wonderful concierge Carlos. Without Carlos, this hotel would be run into the ground. Another wonderful concierge is Vicky, although I had less interaction with her. Finally, there is an additional 18% service charge for room service plus another few dollars...this is unacceptable. Watch your wallet for hidden gratuity charges. My wallet ran dry after one week so be careful. Good luck Four Seasons Miami. You will need it.

Reviews.Title: “So Spotless: They Chase Napkins”
Reviews.Author: annenorman
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this distinguished hotel property for six nights, beginning on 29 December 2010. We had a great time, and we thoroughly enjoyed the property and the team assigned to it. Check-in was precise. We were greeted warmly by a woman named Abbey at the Front Desk. Everything was prepared for us, and she noted that we had been upgraded for the duration of our stay. We found it noteworthy that she walked around to the front of the desk to present the room keys. She then escorted us to the elevators. A nice touch. Abbey had a colleague -- a trainee -- at the desk. Her name was Emmanuella. This delightful young woman worked closely and in harmony with Abbey. She later handled our departure, and she managed that process with poise and precision. Both Abbey and Emmanuella addressed us by name whenever they saw us during our visit -- a nice, personal touch that is rarely seen in domestic hotels. The housekeeping staff was very attentive to detail. The room always was spotless whenever the housekeeper entered, either to make the room or to turn the bed at night. While it is not significant overall, we found that few, if any, of the housekeepers understood English; hene, it was difficult for me to communicate messages with most of them. This was not a burden for me. I now turn to Mr Delgado, a food and beverage manager. We saw him most mornings when we had breakfast. He was a special treat. He always took time to greet us, and to talk about something interesting. Because we ususlly ate outside, we took note that Mr Delgado spent lots of time chasing napkins that were blowing around in the wind. This was impressive; hedidnot delegate this minor task to others -- he did it himself. He paid close attention to detail in discharging his duties. He is a superior leader. Overall, a fine property that is located in the heart of the city's financial district. It is convenient to everythingin the business sector, and is within walking distance of some funky spots on South Miami Blvd. I intend to return soon to chase some napkins.

Reviews.Title: “This is among the worst Four Seasons”
Reviews.Author: TransConFlyer
Reviews.Content: This is not a good hotel, and you should seek other options for a good value or high-end experience in Miami. While several years ago, Four Seasons got off to a good start in Miami, today the hotel feels tired, shopworn and well below the standards elsewhere in the company. The concierge department is all but closed; the furniture in the public areas is nicked or threadbare, and the food in Aqua or poolside is barely edible. The menu is totally uninspired, and it feels like an airport hotdog stand more than a luxury hotel. Go to the JW Marriott up the street for something with a bit of life to it, an excellent menu at DB Bistro Moderne, and an interior decor that feels much more upscale. On a positive note, the Sports Club/LA, to which hotel guests have access in the same building, is extremely well equipped and maintained. There are also excellent therapists in the spa, though be careful - they add gratuity automatically without necessarily pointing this out to you each time. Having stayed at Four Seasons all over the world, it simply seems that the owners in Miami have run out of money, the general manager can't get the job done, or both. Not a lost cause here - there are some very friendly people on the staff - but this is a far cry from what Four Seasons is supposed to be. Try something else.

Reviews.Title: “A solid Four Seasons in the financial area”
Reviews.Author: jolly999
Reviews.Content: All the things that you would expect of a Four Seasons - decent staff who don't snarl at you, nice furnishings, even if the rooms are not quite up to scratch. Nice pool area, but this is essentially a quiet business hotel in the business area. So, in sum, it's fine if not great.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: jofhoffman
Reviews.Content: This was our third stay at the Four Seasons Miami and it was PERFECT. The hotel, the staff, the food, everything was done with care and professionalism. The standar rooms are regular size, and what you'd expect from a "business" hotel but all facilities are there at your disposal. We were kindly upgraded for this last stay and the room size doesnt really differ from the standard, although it's still good. The real difference is just the view (waterview). It's is a Four Seasons property so expect prices for everything to be on the higher end but the entire property (restaurants, rooms, pool area, lobby ) is kept immacultely and a staff member was there to help. It's located downtown but the area has many options for restaurants, etc. For us, it was a God gift to be relatively far from South beach (dont go there, it's a waste of time except for the Art Deco buildings!). All the restaurants and bar we went to downtown and in Coconut Grove (just 15 mins away) were great. You will even forget that you are not in Miami Beach. And trust me, it's better than staying in crowded Miami beach area. The pool area service is spetacular and you will not want to leave ! The lobby has these amazing Botero's statues. It;s impossible not to take a picture ! I have another trip (business) coming up and I am bound to stay there again. You will not regret it.

Reviews.Title: “Top service”
Reviews.Author: been-there-c
Reviews.Content: Four Seasons Miami is not my kind of hotel. As the Ritz isn't either. I am more the small boutique type. I stayed there for a conference and I can say that it was probably the best service I have ever witnessed in my life. The general services, the pool side, the room service, the food, the house keeping. They were attentive, excellent and quick. The only down side I could find was the glacial air conditioning temperature in corridors and general hotel common areas. In summary: superb service.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Alexandralves
Reviews.Content: The Four Seasons in Miami is in downtown and really look like a business hotel, with relatively small rooms. However, is a great 5 stars hotel, with a good staff. One of the rooms we stayed smelled a little, even we asked for non-smoking room. The breakfast is not assorted, but, as I said before, it's a business hotel with business people coming and going and not having time for a big breakfast buffet, I guess. The valet people is also very kind and we had great treatment by all the staff. I've stayed in other hotels in downtown and I guess if I come back to Miami, I would go to Four Seasons again.

Reviews.Title: “Do your self a favor and stay at the Marriott”
Reviews.Author: Skeeter75
Reviews.Content: Hotel was terrible and the staff was rude, unprofessional, and very unhelpful with any request. Experience was more of a Motel 6 than a luxury hotel. The hotel also made a billing error and it took numerous calls (with no return calls) to make them understand and correct. I finally checked out and went to Marriott which was very satisfactory. It was my first, and absolute last time, at a Four Seasons.

Reviews.Title: “Pure luxury and service with a great pool”
Reviews.Author: anon789
Reviews.Content: Our first visit to a Four Seasons and we are sold! The service was terrific--Four Seasons is very accommodating for gluten allergies. Ask for Steven at Acqua. They even keep gluten free bread. The room was beautiful with an amazing view of the bay. The pool is stunning with free cabanas and a view of downtown Miami. Includes free access to fitness club. The food both at Acqua and poolside is out of this world. Room service is excellent-they even call you if they are 4 minutes late, and apologize for it! If we could afford a residence there, we would buy one. It is the financial district so you are not close to the beach or much else culturally, but it is only a 12-25 dollar cab ride away.

Reviews.Title: “REALLY NICE...10/10”
Reviews.Author: dave657
Reviews.Content: We had a week at the FS in March and it was lovely. Its quite a unique hotel, has a top end apartments on the top floors for residence and a brilliant LA fitness gym on the 4th floor which guests can use for free. Its in the Financial district but this doesnt matter as the hotels here are all quality and although its not busy at night there are still a few nice bars and restuarants close by. Theres an argentinian steakhouse/ bar and a sushi siam which we went to when we didnt want to go to South Beach or Coconut Grove which are both ten minutes away. The pool was top drawer as was the service and layout around it, very swish and stylish. No expense spared on the hotel either, funky artwork and amazing statues everywhere. We had a seaview room and the sunset/ rises were gorgeous. Had the brunch on Sunday too, that was good also. There were some guests banging around by the lift one night at 3am and my girlfriend asked if security could move them on, they were really drink and had been at a wedding, We didnt really mind and it was dealt with immediately. We are no different on the odd occasion so this is not a complaint at all. When we checked out they didnt even charge us for that night, it was five days later and to be honest we had forgotten it as soon as the noise was stopped, but the front desk wouldnt take the money off the card. A real nice touch when it wouldnt have mattered anyway. Plus they are doing good deals anyway, my bill was less than I thought it would be too, which was a first. Its not that expensive for what you get, it really isnt and if you want to relax away from the frenzy of South Beach and would rather drop in and out, choose a vastly superior hotel and make it this one because it is really, really smart. We stay at all the good ones worldwide Burj, Beverly Hills etc and this was up there. 10 out of 10.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Building, Beautiful Views, Staff needs some help”
Reviews.Author: MichiganJim2009
Reviews.Content: The hotel is spotless, and the rooms are gorgeous. The staff is cumbersome in some areas. We arrived late around 4pm, actuall 250pm and went right to Acqua and we told we 10 minutes to order and that was that, they were closing. Not a great start. We went back the next afternoon around 1pm and were handed breakfast menus, then dinner menus, then finally lunch after we pointed all this out. Houskeeping is lacking. The dont even move your shoes around to vacuum, and are a bit upset if you are still in your room, when they wanted to clean. Also NO water bottles at turndown. Either go to Valet Parking and they will give you water bottles or call Room Service and get dinged for $40 for bottles. The valet and pool staff are great. You wont find a cleaner property in Miami but the staff have to step up to the quality of the property. The hotel is missing alot of typical FS things they do to make your stay special, You are slightly remote from everything also, Try it, You might like it

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay for work group”
Reviews.Author: czechqueen
Reviews.Content: I organized a top level executive meeting in Miami and we stayed in the hotel. The staff was excellent in managing all our needs. They were extremely helpful with all special request. The rooms were nice and roomy. Really enjoyed the pool over the weekend, nice food serice there. Great location for business meetings and close ot the Miami banking center.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay with 5 year old”
Reviews.Author: IYCNYC
Reviews.Content: We went here in August for a 3 day vacation with our 5 year old daughter. We've stayed in maybe 7-8 Four Seasons and/or Ritz Carltons and this was on par with what we expected. Restaurants were great but expensive (there is a deli in the building next door that serves full breakfasts as well as a French bakery about a 5 minute walk that also serves full breakfasts). The hotel occupanies maybe 20 floors of a building so you end up taking 2 different elevators to get to your room. It is in kind of a business district and did have a business like feel to it. It did surprise us that this is no where near a beach though we had a nice view of the bay. So we ended up driving to Bill Baggs State Park about 15 minutes away. We went to the beach near the lighthouse and swam in the ocean for hours (very warm and very clear). There is a service on the beach where for $20 you get a beach umbrella and two recliners. This beach is more protected and so avoided the "high bacterial counts/unsafe to swim" warnings that occurred at beaches only 1 mile away. In the past we stayed at the Ritz Key Biscayne, which has its own private access to a beach, but there was so much seawood that you couldn't swim or enjoy the sand there. The pool at Four Seasos was nice as well with 3 foot depths at both ends of the pool with various floatation devices (noodles, floating beds, etc). There is also a 1 foot pool that would be great for infants/young toddlers.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable stay”
Reviews.Author: OldCritical
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here before embarking on a transatlantic cruise. We arrived too late to try the dining room for dinner. Our room was very well designed, and extremely comfortable.... especially the bed. The bathroom was well planned, with both bathtub, and separate shower. We had breakfast in the dining room, and it was quite good. I will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “hotel with attitude”
Reviews.Author: gorgeousTaipei
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel for 3 nights via internet. When we checked in, the staff wasn't friendly at all when we ask for detail information about the room setting and view etc. They pretty much showed the attitude that this is what a ordinary tourist gets. Later on,I asked if they offer company rate for the company I work for since I was too rush to check before booking online. Believe it or not, after the staff recognized where I work for ( apparently its a name good enough to earn fourseason's respect), he turned into a extremely respectful and warm person. What a shame. Oh well, just don't forget to visit here with your remarkable business card!

Reviews.Title: “A Decent Four Seasons”
Reviews.Author: bexin
Reviews.Content: Good Four Seasons and located conveniently for travel to all the main areas such as Bayside, South Beach and shopping. The hotel is decent, nothing spectacular, the rooms pretty plain. However the staff are fabulous and made up for the lack of wow'sfrom the hotel. Felt a little businessy, but defeinitely an comfortable stay. Great beds, great value!!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful rooms and a wonderful pool”
Reviews.Author: Dramashley
Reviews.Content: Went there for one night for a little getaway and truly was able to relax even though it was only for 24 hours. Enjoyed the beautiful pool and had a delicious pomegranate mojito. The service at the pool was great and the lounge chairs are very comfortable. The room we were in had a big screen LG flatscreen which was nice to have and the bathroom had a separate tub and shower with the massaging shower head. The turn down service was great and we felt very pampered. I would definitely recommend this hotel for a nice getaway.

Reviews.Title: “Perfection is relaxing”
Reviews.Author: PittDoc
Reviews.Content: No question this is a Four Seasons! If you need to be on Brickell Avenue or you just love the view of Biscayne Bay, try and stay here. Here are the things to know that were nice surprises: There is coffee in the lobby until 8AM in the morning, there is no charge for the cabanas at the pool, there is a great walk way around the Bay, there is no attitude and there is a very nice international crowd. If you need breakfast or a healthy lunch or don't want the lobby coffee service, go to Pasha's which is on the fourth floor in the street elevator stack.

Reviews.Title: “one of my best experiences”
Reviews.Author: gautammohta
Reviews.Content: four seasons miami, well in word word if i had to describe my experience, it would be "wow". every detail of the various aspects, which would make a guest comfortable, has been covered by this marvellous hotel. we were welcomed with a smile, with the receptionist acknowledging us by our names. we got lucky i guess by getting a free upgrade to their suites.:) the view of the ocean front fromour room was beautiful. the rooms, incredibly nice and a beautiful bathroom, providing all facilities which we can ask for. the food that we ordered was very nice, and served beautifully. the staff was very courteous, friendly and responsive to our needs and queries. i would definitely recommend this hotel , for not just a stay, but for an experience as well.:)

Reviews.Title: “Four Seasons Heaven in Miami”
Reviews.Author: cnalsc
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Four Seasons for a recent trip to Florida that ended with three days in Miami. After lots of driving and so-so hotels, this was like heaven on earth. Beautiful rooms, heavenly beds and pillows, wonderful bathrooms with lots of light and counter and storage space, quiet rooms and air conditioning, and perfect service. Wonderful well equipped gym. Yes, you pay for parking and internet access (as well as all that tipping) but it's worth it.

Reviews.Title: “expected more”
Reviews.Author: la femme folle
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed for just 1 night at the Four Seasons expecting it to be on par with other FS that I have stayed at. I was disappointed. There was no sign of a server at the pool area for nearly 2 hours. The front desk was inconvenienced by me as was the concierge. Food was mediocre, I was served a burnt english muffin as my continental breakfast. There are no Ipod docking stations in the room, so you have to lug it up from the concierge desk and promise to return it, really? The pool is beautiful, but unless you need to be in this area, I would suggest the Conrad across the street for half the price.

Reviews.Title: “Never again!!!”
Reviews.Author: Melanie_G10184
Reviews.Content: We booked into the Four Seasons having prepaid for 4 nights. The minute you take the lift up to the hotel foyer there is this overwhelming smell of detergent trying to cover up a bad smell (Our conclusion was because the hotel allows pets it could be to cover up the smell of the mess the dogs leave). The staff at check in were efficient and friendly, they even upgraded our room from a deluxe to a premier room so we could have a better view. However the minute we entered our room, we were immediately disappointed. The room decor is ugly to put it mildly. The furniture is outdated oak, the decor is plain and dull, the bed was uncomfortable and the carpet looked dirty and stained. I have stayed at 5 star hotels around the world and this hotel should be categorised as a 3 star. Dont bother with room service, even though the service is friendly and efficient the food is horrible. We ordered a few times and were very disappointed. We had dinner at the restaurant in the hotel, there were only 2 other tables booked that night, the food was average and the staff friendly, however the staff at the adjacent bar should be fired for being so rude, we were ignored even though we walked up and sat at the bar counter. The area outside the restaurant which leads to the pool looked like it had not been cleaned in a while. The rooms were so depressing to be in that we couldn't wait to leave, so even though we paid for 4 nights, we checked out after 3 nights. If you are in Miami for a holiday then this is the worst location to be in, rather book somewhere close to South Beach. You can also expect to pay about $34 for valet + tax which i think is too overpriced.

Reviews.Title: “don't leave money in your car”
Reviews.Author: Hillary6503
Reviews.Content: Just got back from this very nice hotel. I was going to stay in South Beach but decided against it as spring break is on and I'm glad because South Beach looked like a gong show when I drove down for the day. This hotel is a bit off the beaten path but with the city metro mover and a rental car we had no troubles getting around. I found the food very good. The service is what you would expect from a Four Seasons Hotel. Be prepared to hand out money for tips and extras. You pay for parking, you pay for internet, you tip the bellman, you tip the maid, you tip the pool service employees. It does add up but they deserve it because the service is truly exceptional. My trip would have been perfect except one night when I left my car with the valet, about 25 bucks went missing that I had left in the console to use for toll bridges and parking lots. 25$ out of my final 7500$ bill really is a drop in the bucket, but it really upset me that an employee of a hotel like that would help himself to my parking money. It serves me right for leaving cash in a rental. I hope George reads this and keeps a closer eye on his valets. Overall, great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “My Best Stay Ever”
Reviews.Author: travelholic_mom
Reviews.Content: I wished I could've stayed more !!!! Loved my room, the pool, the location right on Brickell Ave !!! It was my best stay ever !!!! We got and amazing rate on Expedia so it made our stay even better. The lychee martini at "14Thirty-Five" lounge is to die for!! Extremely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great views”
Reviews.Author: LondonBurl
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here four times and the hotel never fails to impress. Our room was large and very comfortable with fabulous views towards Key Biscayne. The pool is huge and service friendly and attentive. The location is some distance from South Beach but convenient for a number of Miami sights. The food is good and there are a number of restaurants near by at Mary Brickell village.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing Maimi get-away”
Reviews.Author: name_screen
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 6 nights at Four Seasons Miami for a leisurely get-away. Rooms - stayed in standard king room, included in-room safe (large enough for computer), DVD player, flat-screen TV, iron, mini-bar, and excellent toiletries in marble bath with separate shower. The housekeeping service seemed slow and sometimes missed restocking towels and/or toiletries. Bed was comfortable and room was fairly quiet. Location - situated in the Finacial District, it's an excellent location for those not interested in the South Beach scene. It is one block to the free metro-mover monorail, which can take you to many points of interest in Miami. Services - concierge service was excellent for recommendations on dining options and things to do. Pool was large included a hot tub and excellent pool attendant service. Towels and pad covers are provided. Nearby dining/food options - In the adjacent Grupo Santander building and about 1 minute away, a great breakfast diner "Deli Lane Cafe" provides indoor and outdoor seating and typical fare of eggs, pancakes, omlettes, etc. A 5 minute walk away is the Parisian Artisan Cafe for breakfast/lunch, across from the JW Marriott on Brickell and has excellent fresh breakfast options, pastries, salads, sandwiches, etc. Novecento, also on Brickell and across the street, has casual dining with great food - the empanadas were tasty. Other good dining options were in the Mary Brickell Village, 2 stops away on the free metromover (or a 10 minute walk) - several restaurants in this area were all good.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, impeccable service”
Reviews.Author: AKMonty
Reviews.Content: Although we stayed at the Four Seasons Miami a year and a half ago, I wanted to write this review to let people know how wonderful the hotel is. It is everything you expect a Four Seasons to be. The front desk employees were calling me by name, "Good morning, Mrs. ...". The pool is wonderful. Very serene and quiet. The food is outstanding. Hotel room outstanding. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Don't vacation here. Bad location.”
Reviews.Author: HabsFan21
Reviews.Content: The pictures on the website are accurate, but misleading. The pool looks nice and tranquil with palm trees all around, but what it doesn't show is that it's on the 6th floor and surrounded by skyscrappers. If you want to stare at office buildings, then this is the place for you. If you are looking for a fun vacation, stay somewhere else. We had originally booked 3 nights, but we left after only one and found a beautiful beach front hotel instead. The hotel is mixed with an office tower. You have to switch elevators to get to your room. Self parking is $30 a day. Internet is $15/day. We paid $395/night + extras + taxes. This would probably be a great hotel for business travel, but that's about it. If you do stay here, do yourself a favour and walk down to SW13& Brickell to the German Pub/microbrewery. Great food and drink. This hotel is in the financial district. Not much in the way of amenities.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for Older People or Business Travel”
Reviews.Author: VacaRae
Reviews.Content: We stayed here one night before moving ourselves to W South Beach. The Four Seasons hotel itself was beautiful however our suite decor and odor reminded me of something more enjoyed by the Golden Girls and it wasn't what we were looking for on this trip. The pool area was beautiful and the service was excellent. However I did not get the feel that this Four Seasons was on par quality-wise as other Four Seasons of which I am a fan of. If you do not have a need to specifically be in Brickell I do not recommend staying here. Do not be fooled by the Four Seasons name, I would rather go somewhere else and be by the ocean and more action. This hotel would be good for older 65+ couples who want quiet and luxury away from the action or for business.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in Downtown Miami”
Reviews.Author: krishna98
Reviews.Content: My family and I went to Miami for a short winter break and stayed at this hotel. The service is mostly top notch and professional- just what you would expect from the Four Seasons. The rooms were nice, but not over the top. Since the hotel is downtown, some of the views from the rooms overlook streets and other buildings, not very pretty or scenic. But since we went for the weather and beach, we didn't spend that much time in our room. The hotel is a 5-10 minute drive from Key Biscayne, which has some amazing beaches appropriate from small kids. We spent most of our time on Key Biscayne. The rooftop pool was one of the nicest I've ever seen. Everything from the pool to the landscaping was just stunning. It really looked like an oasis. The only problem we had during our stay was the service at the pool. We were there between Christmas and New Years and it was crowded. I think we found the last few empty chairs. Every afternoon we went, the poolside service was far below Four Season standards. It took us awhile to flag an attendant down to get towels. Not a single attendant approached us to see if we needed anything. We didn't bother ordering food or drinks- I don't think we could have gotten an attendant to take our order. They were racing around us and it looked like they didn't want to make eye contact in case someone were to flag them down. I think they were either understaffed or inexperienced, so handling a big poolside group was difficult for them. Other than the poolside service, everything else was fine for a top tier hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Always feels like home!”
Reviews.Author: ATM72
Reviews.Content: This is my second time staying at the FS Miami. Checked in on 12/25/09 for two nights. In town to see family. Was upgraded to a 1 bedroom suite. Loved it! I can always depend on the FS for a lovely bed and a good night's sleep. The soundproofing in the rooms is second to none! Great views from my 36th floor room. Great service. Lovely place to stay in the heart of Brickell. Close to Mary Brickell shopping center etc. If you want to stay away from the craziness of south beach, the FS is an awesome choice! First class property! Never disappoints! And they keep everything so clean and elegant!

Reviews.Title: “Nice!”
Reviews.Author: PBK007
Reviews.Content: Arrived at the Four Seasons Hotel in Brickell, Miami, FL on Dec 21st. Left on the 24Th. At arrival valet and concierge staff was very polite and service minded... you enter the hotel via a side ramp from brickell Ave, you take the next right and there is the ramp. You walk in to a huge building on the ground floor. It looks like a business/financial building. You have to take an elevator to go to the hotel Lobby which is on the 7Th floor. The building has Offices, Hotel, and residences. The hotel floors are 7 and form 20 to 29. Front desk was fast and helpful. Hotel rooms are OK. I thought they where going to be outrageous, but not! The y are nice. Bathroom is however amazing, as so are the beds and pillows. Rooms are comfy and good size! Large LCD TV, minibar, etc... Lobby is nice and the pool is awesome! The fitness center ands spa are on the 4Th floor. The spa is great! I got a deep tissue massage very good, expensive $170USD for 55 mins but good. Fitness center has every machine you need. Food is good. Valet is expensive $34 a day and Internet for 24hrs periods is 15 usd. Overall is a great place!

Reviews.Title: “THe very best of Miami!!!”
Reviews.Author: Liylly
Reviews.Content: We were supposed to stay in Epic Hotel last weekend,but Epic was having problems with water contamination,that`s why we were moved to Four Seasons.My husband and I fell in love por this hotel!!!Wonderful proprierty,amazing pools,the service was excellent.We were lucky to be helped for an extremely nice brazilian manager,Mr Luciano,and he made our stay the best of all!!! Quiet and clean room,L`Occitane amenities at the bathroom,a small kitchen,huge walk in closet.We really became fans!!!

Reviews.Title: “Understated Luxury”
Reviews.Author: TravelGav
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights after a cruise. On previous occasions we've stayed at hotels in South Beach so this time we wanted to try a different area and take advantage of some great rates at the non-beach hotels. I was pleasantly surprised at the level of service at the Four Seasons; it was consistently high yet not in a false or smothering way. Check in / out was particularly impressive as it was made such a personal experience - never before have I had someone walk out from behind the reception desk to hand me my key. The hotel is decorated throughout in a very understated way from the enormous statues in both the ground floor lobby and 7th-floor reception to the corridors on each floor furnished with side tables, lamps and pictures, so unlike the dull or bland public areas you find in many hotels. The room on the relatively-low 25th floor (the building has 70 floors) was large and bright with a great cushioned window seat looking out over the urban landscape. The kingsize bed was wonderful - firm but comfortable with the softest Italian sheets. The bathroom was very large and well-equipped - with a separate marble/glass shower cubicle and wc in another room - complete with L'Occitane toiletries. We spent a couple of hours down by the pool which was heated to a very pleasant temperature and again the service was very good with plenty of towels and chilled water supplied by the courteous attendants. One feature that I only noticed after leaving was how quiet the stay had been. We knew there were other guests on the same floor but we never heard them - the rooms seem to be very well soundproofed. Although the hotel is on Brickell Av in the financial district there are many places to eat if you do some research first all within a 5 min walk - Novecento, Dolores But You Can Call Me Lolita, Rosinella, Morton's, as well as all the hotel restaurants along Brickell Av. Provided the rate was right I would happily stay at the Four Seasons again on another trip to Miami.

Reviews.Title: “Not what I thought a Four Seasons was suppose to be”
Reviews.Author: atwoodsa
Reviews.Content: I came to Miami for a weekend getaway with my boyfriend. We chose the Four Seasons because we wanted a great place to stay. While the hotel is nice it isn't what I expected from the Four Seasons. I travel a lot for work (~150k miles per year) and this just seems like an overpriced business hotel. The food was overly priced and nothing special ($80 for room service for 2 people???), the beds are not that comfortable (the Westin and W offer much better rooms) and at times the "service" seemed overwhelming (6 people approached us as we got out of the car). The worst was the first night we arrived we stayed in a room where the maid service was up and down the stairs starting at 3am in the morning and didn't stop all day. The manager agreed to upgrade us to a "premium room" and that just ended up being the same room 1 floor up. Bottom line not worth the money or the name. If you are looking for a business hotel, stay at JW Marriott. If you are looking for pleasure... don't stay here.

Reviews.Title: “a cold stay”
Reviews.Author: tintin23
Reviews.Content: The hotel interiors are fabulous , having excellent sculptures by fernando. The hotel location is good for business purpose otherwise the evenings and nights are very boring, may one of the worst i ever stayed. The food was pathetic in the bar as it was sunday and the main restaurant was closed.

Reviews.Title: “Great place at the right RATE”
Reviews.Author: Dynosour
Reviews.Content: My Wife and I recently took our 12 year old, and 3 year old down to Keywest FL for a family vacation. We spent our first two nights at the four seasons hotel in Miami. By far, this is the best hotel in the area. There is no way I would take my family down to south beach. We ate, rented bicycles and shopped downtown, yes. Sleeping? Oh God no. Way too much noise, dirt, freaks, and congestion for my taste. With that said, would I ever pay full price for a room at the four seasons? Of course NOT! My broker has a travel service which got us our room at a 50% discount. I consider this to be a fair price. We had a one bedroom suite with a living room. The living room had a pull out bed for our 12 year old. The 3 year old sleep with us. VERY quiet and clean. loved it. The Bathroom is amazing. Fully separate tub, shower, and toilet. Get the Ocean view. It's worth the extra hundred bucks. Service was excellent. Food was AWESOME! Pool is top notch. Very much a 5 Star establishment. Looking forward to returning next year.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Destination”
Reviews.Author: MDejean
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Four Seasons, Miami for one night for a weekend getaway. It is by far one of the best hotels I have stayed in. The staff was courteous, the room luxurious, the view breathtaking, the amenities world class, and the decor impressive. I can't say enough about this destination, and they will definitely see us again. Kudos!!!

Reviews.Title: “Peel and wrap”
Reviews.Author: Dorsetblue
Reviews.Content: We flew in from the UK and the second we got out of the cab it was like the stresses and fatigue of workday life and travel were gently peeled from you...seamless baggage handling,check in, room........stunning - looking over the bay from the windowseat you just couldn't be anything other than chilled. ...and then, for anything from morning coffee to pool to concierge service to housekeeping requests and on and on, you were just wrapped in discreet, focussed attention to, at worse meet your needs and usually to anticipate them. How they give you that "at home" feeling in such a stunning property with so much good art is a skill that they need to cherish because it makes for devoted customers. Thank you for a wonderful stay.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury you can trust”
Reviews.Author: FerreeFlowers
Reviews.Content: Located in the heart of Miami this the 4 season is a premier hotel that host and cater to everyone of ours needs. The hotel restaurant was outstanding, while the rooms were top notch, elegant, refined and well maintained. Even the Queen of England would be satisfied with this gem

Reviews.Title: “Just Brilliant”
Reviews.Author: Fitzy2
Reviews.Content: This was our second time at this hotel. It's lovely - the staff are very friendly, the lobby is superb, the rooms are amazing, and the pool is sooooo relaxing. If you want to go somewhere to recharge, then this is the perfect spot. We intend to return.

Reviews.Title: “My favorite hotel in Miami”
Reviews.Author: ajs1974mia
Reviews.Content: Recently I had some work done on my condo that required me to check in to a local hotel. The Four Seasons was running a promotion that had a reasonable rate for two nights and added a complimentary third night. I have stayed at several other nice hotels, including two other Four Seasons, several Ritz properties, a couple of St. Regis properties, and a Peninsula property. This property has become my third favorite hotel in the U.S., and definitely my favorite in Miami. (FYI -- Four Seasons St. Louis ranks first, and the St. Regis San Fran ranks second). The highlights -- service is excellent, rooms are spacious with incredible views of the water (I stayed in a "moderate" room), the food is delicious, and the amenities are top notch. Lowlights -- the Four Seasons professes not to "nickel and dime" its customers but unfortunately I saw some of that at this location -- e.g., you have to pay for wireless (approximately $12 to $15 per night), significant food delivery charges, overpriced minibar (St. Louis charges much less for same items), outrageous parking fees ($34 per night), and pencils instead of pens in the room. I understand that this is a top notch hotel and so you get what you pay for, but some of this (particularly the exorbitant parking fee) is simply unnecessary. With that said, the positive experiences far outweighed the negative ones at this property and I can say without hesitation that this is my favorite hotel in Miami. Here is a more detailed description of my stay: ROOM -- spacious for the price (again, I booked a "moderate" room), but not as big as the St. Louis FS property rooms. They just installed beautiful big screen LCD televisions in the rooms, but they don't have any high definition channels yet so the TVs kind of go to waste. Fortunately I brought my PS3 and was able to watch BluRay movies in 1080p quality. I'm told that high def channels will be added in early October. While they're at it they should add an electronic TV guide. The windows in the room are nice and big (though not floor to ceiling) and there's a ledge you can sit on to read, use your laptop, or chill while looking out the window, which is a really nice touch. The problem is that there are three layers of drapes you have to wade through to get to the window and the first layer covers up a significant portion of the window so the room doesn't maximize this feature. The bathroom is very spacious with a stand up shower, really nice tub that has arm rests, large mirror (no TV in them though like the St. Louis property), separate toilet room, and heated marble floor panels. There's a large working desk (which I used a great deal) and you can view the TV while using the desk or position the chair to just as easily look through the window. There is wired and wireless internet available at a charge of approximately $12 to $15 per day (this was a no-no, it needs to be incorporated into the room rate or something). There's also a very comfortable lounge chair with foot stool. The AC in my room blew out very cold air all the time, but this was promptly fixed when I brought it to management's attention. The bed is your typically incredible Four Seasons bed with linens that are made of an angel's wings, pillows that are filled with feathers of the finest geese in the world, and a mattress stuffed with clouds. One day I'm gonna buy one for my house. SERVICE -- the service is great. Employees go out of their way to be friendly and anticipate your needs. For example, the bar by the pool makes a great raspberry lemonade drink. This wasn't on the room service menu but room service went out of their way to make a whole pitcher for me so I had it in my room throughout my stay. Special appreciation goes out to Mario (the front office manager) who went out of his way before I arrived to make sure I would enjoy my stay and followed up with me afterwards. Also Mario in room service (not the same guy) was very courteous, friendly, conversational, and was always smiling. These two employees epitomize what the FS stands for --treat others like you would like to be treated. FOOD -- one word: delicious! Try the baked sea bass and the chive mashed potatoes. I had this meal every single evening while I was there it was so good. For lunch, the wagyu burger and bolognese were excellent. Only down side is that it's expensive. A two course meal without alcohol costs approximately $90 when you include tip and the service/delivery charges. I did not try Acqua (the on site restaurant) during this stay but I have in the past and can assure you it is not as good as the in room dining. POOL -- the pool is really nice and the attendants there make sure your every whim is catered to with a smile. Nancy and Zola were terrific. Always there to refill my drinks or give me free samples of fruit and smoothies. If you don't fancy the raspberry lemonade (which is not on the menu) then ask for the Banana Bahia (like a banana shake with cinnamon and vanilla). SPA -- The spa is way overpriced but the treatments are pretty good. The spa at the St. Louis property is far better at half the price. GYM -- the gym is a Sports Club LA. I am a member since I live in Miami, so I was familiar with it. It is well equipped and the personal trainers are popular (if you're thinking of purchasing a session ask for Alan, who has been there the longest and is the most popular). Some of the treadmills are old, but they all have their own personal television screens (even if the reception is unpredictable). Busy time is between 7 and 8:30 a.m., and between 6 and 8 p.m. You do NOT want to visit the gym during those hours of the week. PARKING -- this is where this property receives its lowest marks. The attendants and bellhops are wonderful, but the pricing is outrageous. $34 per night is simply too high even for Miami's standards, and especially for Brickell's standards. I paid $100 to park my car for three nights. This was a joke. They need to change this -- lower the rate to $15 or $20 per night max or at least give guests a decent option to self-park (the current option is $30 per night so you may as well use valet). MISCELLANEOUS -- if you're a tennis fan/player, this is the hotel for you. They have a great relationship with the Brickell Tennis Club, which is the premier tennis facility in downtown Miami. The pros there are excellent and the clinics are a lot of fun. In sum, I had a really great stay at this property. I'm going to return for a "staycation" at some point in the near future, without a doubt. It was a great way to unwind while being pampered for the weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: SharonlondonU.K
Reviews.Content: When we first arrived we were given a suite with a king size bed which is NOT what we booked 6 months before! We had booked a room with twin beds as we ALWAYS do but they had double booked our room so we were not impressed, as my husband and I do not sleep well in the same bed unfortunatly as he moves about a lot and gets very hot! So he sent the first night on a pull out sofa bed?! Not a good start. Anyway we ended up getting that night complimentry (so we should as thats not what we booked) then we moved to another very nice deluxe twin room with a great view! Room was a good size too! Only disappointment was the very old tv set, very bad picture quality when I ordered a pay per view film! I mean even 3 star hotels have new plasmas/HD tvs these days! Other than that it was a very nice stay, the restaurant was average though. The concierge was great he even managed to get us into The Liv club Erick Morilo end of music conference party ;-)! And the pool was perfect!

Reviews.Title: “Paradise Away From South Beach...”
Reviews.Author: kobekeith
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with a friend after 5 days in a dump on South Beach so the last 4 nights of our vacation were like an awesome dream! It's really, really far from the beach but if you can afford to stay here then you can afford to take a taxi to the beach or clubs during the day or evening. The pool was clean and quiet and relaxing. The service at the pool was great. The concierge staff was amazing. They helped me find Japanese-speaking tours for my friend. That took a lot of calling on their part but they found us something. We booked a 3-hour private jet-ski tour and it was well-worth the price. It was a drastic change from the National Hotel on South Beach and the best choice we made.

Reviews.Title: “Great place, but stay closer to Miami Beach if you're a tourist like me!”
Reviews.Author: Nutria2008
Reviews.Content: I stayed there in early May 09. I took advantage of low airfares and flew from Los Angeles non-stop for only $280 on American. Chose the Four Seasons because I had never been to Miami and didn't know the city very well, and didn't want to stay in a bad part of town. FS are never in a bad part of town, and the hotel didn't disappoint. Very nicely done, usual great amenities, and I'll give it five out of five for everything, especially the very friendly staff. The concierges gave good directions for tourist stuff, and the hotel itself is located overlooking Biscayne Bay. On arrival, I was upgraded without asking to a bayside room, with a great view from the 27th floor. The only thing is, as one reviewer commented, it is downtown, and is probably more useful for business travelers. After dark, the downtown area, like that in Los Angeles, shuts down. And it is amidst other skyscrapers, so the setting is no different than any other metropolitan city. No real beaches are nearby, the waterfront is all commercial/residential with no sand. That being said, I'm not complaining, because I did not do sufficient research, so that setting and location are all on me. The hotel is excellent, but if you're a tourist, stay on Miami Beach, plenty of great hotels, restaurants, clubs, and beautiful beaches. Next time, that's where I'll be! The only odd thing, in all the other Four Seasons I've visited (Scottsdale, Las Vegas, North San Diego, San Francisco), there were coffeemakers in the room. None here. Oh, and if in Miami, check out Little Havana. What a great little community, friendly, great Cuban coffee, great food, great cigars! Happy travels, all.

Reviews.Title: “Nice FS hotel”
Reviews.Author: MrMeToo
Reviews.Content: Just returned from the Four Seasons Miami from a weekend in Miami and it was pleasant experience . The hotel is very impressive and the staff were helpful when needed. The restaurant Aqua in the hotel is good food , ok service but nothing really impessed too much , it was ok . In the area there is nightlife outside althgouh not much . South beach is abour 15 minutes away from here. It was a very nice hotel , in a tall building in miami's fniancial district .

Reviews.Title: “Neither/nor...”
Reviews.Author: Member in Philadelphia
Reviews.Content: We recently found ourselves at the Miami Four Seasons for the second time in three months, and it still just isnâ€™t one of our favorite FS properties. I felt this after the first time, and this second visit reinforced my thought that it just doesnâ€™t feel like what I would consider a typical Four Seasons Hotel. The staff is all as I would expect, helpful and attentive, the rooms are the high standard I have come to expect from a Four Seasons, the restaurant is niceâ€¦ but the location and the physical building just leave me cold. You could be staying in an anonymous office tower anywhere in the world rather than in a Four Seasons. The room views of Biscayne Bay are pleasant although through minimally operable, curtain wall windows. The pool is on the seventh floor and is fine and the staff helpful, but is surrounded by high rise office and residential towers and feels clinical and disconnected from any specific location. If it werenâ€™t for the paving-bound palm trees reminding you it is somewhere tropical, it could be truly anywhere. The gym is well equipped but since it is not directly connected to the hotel it seems nameless and you are usually outnumbered by membership business people from the surrounding offices. What we most appreciate and have come to expect in Four Seasons hotels is the feel of unique familiarity of the FS stay. That experience is less than memorable in this property as hard as the staff try to make it otherwise. We left after both visits feeling we had a nice â€œhotel stayâ€� rather than the usual unforgettable Four Seasons experience. Too bad.

Reviews.Title: “Four Seasons Consistency”
Reviews.Author: zenjuris
Reviews.Content: My wife, toddler son and I stayed two nights at the Four Seasons Miami in March 2009. On the same trip, we also stayed at the Doubletree Beachcomber Hotel, which is reviewed separately. The Good: The rooms, facilities, service and food were everything one would expect from a Four Seasons hotel. The pool area is lovely, the pool staff did a wonderful job of attending to all of our needs, and the water temperature was perfect. A prior reviewer had commented about a window seat running the length of the window in her room that overlooked the bay. We had a similar seat and view, and she was right about it being a fantastic place to pass the time. The Bad: $34 per night for parking. The hotel is also located in the financial district, where there is not much to see (but then again, the hotel is nice enough that you could easily never want to venture outside the property). The Unexpected: High-speed internet access was free for people whose high-speed internet service provider at home is AT&T. (Apparently AT&T owns the company that provides the service.) We like staying at Four Seasons hotels because they offer child-friendly properties, comfortable rooms and fantastic service. They excel at making guests feel as if they are in an oasis of understated luxury. The Four Seasons Miami is no exception. At $295 per night, the Four Seasons Miami also offered good value. Miami hotels are expensive. A mediocre hotel in the South Beach area would cost at least $250 per night, and a hotel of the same caliber as the Four Seasons but in the South Beach area would run well over $500 per night. If you do not want to be by the beach, you can get a lot more hotel for the same price by staying at the Four Seasons Miami.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel worth a stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from Miami, staying at the four seasons Hotel which we really enjoyed. We couldnt understand most of the bad reviews as we thought it was a beautiful hotel, lovely gardens, imaginative swimming areas, with clean rooms with balcony and views. The staff were friendly and helpful, although a little cold and not very flexible .We ate in the hotel twice. The food was first class and we had no complaints about the breakfast with a vast array of dishes. Hotel also had great fitness facilities. Loved Miami, though it was quite touristy.. Would definitely go again but may be not in February as it was very humid with unstable weather.

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: McMug
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice hotel, great service. I love all the Fernando Botero statues they put there, and the hotel definitely smells very nice everywhere. The staff is very courteous and attentive to customers. We got upgraded automatically, and also got continental breakfast in the room once we arrived. We ordered room service and the food was great. The Aqua was not as good as expected though. The pool was really nice although it was a little chilly the couple days we were there, so didn't get spend time there. They're also affiliated with LA Sports Club, so you can work out there. The gym is definitely very nice. It's located in the Financial district, 30 minutes from the South Beach. For me, it generally is not a problem, because I stayed at South Beach last time I was in Miami and didn't like it that much. The only problem with the location is that there's no convenience stores/starbucks nearby (I mean like within 5 minutes for walking). Overall I found the stay to be excellent. You can hardly go wrong with a Four Seasons hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for a Long Weekend”
Reviews.Author: jcsjs
Reviews.Content: This was my first experience staying at a Four Seasons, so I was very excited to experience, firsthand, the "Legendary Luxury" that I have heard about. I will start by saying that we selected this location because we were offered a very lucrative rate due to some connections. That said, we had a very spacious one-bedroom suite that had one and a half bathrooms. While very spacious, I was not necessarily impressed with the "luxury" offered in the room. We did have two televisions, but neither of them were plasma. For a Four Seasons, I would have assumed that a plasma TV would be de rigeur. Other than that, I found the rooms to be spotless, comforatble, tasteful, and spacious, but not necessarily "luxurious". Second, the building has a layout that is common in many large cities like NYC (where I am from), in that the lobby is on the seventh floor. Not an issue, necessarily, unless you need to/want to access a car. You need to take two, or in some cases three, different elevators to access your vehicle. If you do it frequently, it can be a bit tedious. So, if you don't expect to go far, or leave much, it's a non-issue. Third, I thought that the pool area was suberb, and the Sports Club LA and adjoining spa services, were convenient, and top notch. The service at the pool was impeccable, as well - unobtrusive yet attentive - not at all obsequious as is often the case at a Ritz Carlton, where everything is their pleasure. I would caution people, however on a couple of minor but noteworthy things. First, this location is in downtown Miami where there is still, for some reason, a building boom. You can actually hear the construction from the pool during the work week. Second, as has already been noted by other reviewers, the location is not convenient to any beach. One could be quite content staying at the pool area, like we were. However, I think after a three or four night stay, that might become trite. That is why I categorize this as a great getaway. I liken this establishment to being in a luxurious cocoon that just happens to be in Miami. Lots of NY'ers would probably feel comfortable in this hotel because everything is within the building, the service is impeccable, and it caters to inidividuals with sophisticated palettes. If you are adventuresome, however, and like to be in the thick of things, and like to walk outside and feel engergized, this would not make you happy. You have to drive or take a taxi to an energized area.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly Service in Miami?!”
Reviews.Author: novatravelreview
Reviews.Content: I've been to the Four Seasons Miami about a dozen times on both business and pleasure for the last 4 years. Most people looking to visit Miami/Miami Beach should be aware that it is a party town and as a result most hotels are concerned with filling rooms, not pleasing customers. That being said, the Four Seasons Miami truly stands out with its world-class staff and commitment to excellence. Every time I've stayed here the service has been perfect, after the second visit the concierge and front desk remembered my name and greeted me with a smile at all times. The restaurant at the four seasons, while a bit pricey, has one of the most impressive sunday brunches in all of Miami. Everything from Stone Crab Claws, to Sushi, to Smoked Salmon, to Carved Meats await your all-you-can eat gourmet food desires. One of the most relaxing parts of the four seasons is the pool, or pools for that matter. The pools are located on top of the parking garage (7 stories above ground) and overlook the Miami Bay. The pools are always well staffed and cabana service is available. Beware - you will pay four seasons prices for cocktails, so be ready for a large bill if you plan on having multiple drinks though-out the day. Recent construction along Brickell Ave has caused some of the rooms to be noisy, while I've experienced this twice, both times the receptionist moved me to a new room on a different corner with no questions asked. As with all four seasons be sure to check if they have corporate discounts for your company prior to making a reservation!

Reviews.Title: “Luxury in Miami”
Reviews.Author: JP3CHICAGO
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the FS Miami in October 2008. It was a two night stay prior to our departure on a cruise. Thank goodness we had those two nights of luxury prior to getting on the boat! The hotel is in the financial district so if you expect a hotel with a beach feel then do not book here. It is an isolated area after dark although we did stumble on some nightlife close by at an area known as the Mary Brickell district. This provided some good food and drink options. The rooms are quiet and clean. We were offered a $100 upgrade at check in to a one bedroom suite in tier 10 and we accepted. It had a nice view of the pool and the bay. The layout of the room was good although other reviewers noted that the bedroom area was not overly spacious. I agree with their opinions but would not let it hold me back from reserving this type of room in the future. As for the elevator situation we did not find this to be an issue. A few other reviews made light that upon return to this hotel there is a separate elevator that takes you from the parking area to the lobby where you switch to another lift that takes you to the rooms. We did not find this to be a big deal! The same thing happens at the FS Chicago. I think that it actually helps the FS security better monitor who is in the hotel. This is important to some of their clientele such as the Sacramento Kings from the NBA who were also staying at the property those nights. The pool area and workout facilities are excellent. Food and beverage service was also solid. Overall it was a predictable excellent Four Seasons experience and we look forward to our return. If you are looking for a luxury city feel hotel in Miami you have found a great choice!

Reviews.Title: “The epitome of professionalism”
Reviews.Author: LindaB66250
Reviews.Content: I seldom write reviews online however I felt compelled this time to take the time to say "thank you" to the wonderful staff that made my 5 night stay here just wonderful. From the bell captain to the concierge to the housekeeping staff, everyone was absolutely the epitome of professionalism. I will be certainly to return the next time I visit. Thank you all again.

Reviews.Title: “yes it was perfect”
Reviews.Author: mercedesk
Reviews.Content: let me tell you all you need to know. I've been several times to miami before, each time different hotel: hilton, mandarin oriental, conrad, sofitel. that was the first time to the 4 season miami and this hotel is so far with mandarin the best hotel for me in this area; the hotel location is ok but not the best ideal one (it's on brickell, business area, a lot of building construction); teh hotel ot self is perfect (service++, staff very nice and attentive), the room are nice (confortable bed, big bathroom), the service xtra (spa, sport club, hair saloon) are perfect. in brief, this hotel is absolutly one of the best of miami and yes you can go your eyes close believe me!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service”
Reviews.Author: snoodlefish
Reviews.Content: After a long and troublesome journey from London arriving at the Four Seasons made it all worthwhile immediately. I was obviously tired and while my partner was checking in I was taken to the room to freshen up. After a long hot shower in the extremely well appointed bathroom I felt soooo much better. Everything was spotless and top quality. The pool area was fabulous. The staff keeping us topped up with iced water, coming round with chilled face cloths and watermelon every now and again was a nice touch. The martinis before dinner were superb. Have just booked our 3rd stay pre and post cruise. It's a cab ride away from South Beach but well worth it. There's a great breakfast place round the corner if you don't want to pay Four Season prices for coffee. Everyone should stay at a Four Seasons at least once!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice”
Reviews.Author: lancerodman
Reviews.Content: This is a very, very nice hotel, with wonderful staff. My wife and I stayed for two nights in August and were very satisfied with our stay, and would gladly return. We were in a â€œbay viewâ€� room, and I would concur with another reviewer who said that the â€œbay viewâ€� room isnâ€™t all that great. While you can see the bay, in between the bay and the hotel are a number of condominium-type buildings, as well as big parking lots. So the view is far from breathtaking (I didnâ€™t see the â€œcity view,â€� so canâ€™t comment on that), and it didnâ€™t help that the exterior of our hotel window was very much on the dirty side. The pool is real selling point (even if youâ€™re somewhat surrounded by those condo buildings). Itâ€™s big, long (34 meters) lots of nice chairs, great staff, and free cabanas. If you're looking for South Beach-style bling, this isn't your place. If youâ€™re choosing between the Four Seasons and the Mandarin, the pool at the Four Seasons is far superior. Much bigger, and with much more space around it. Similarly, having access to the Sports Club/LA at the Four Seasons is a big plus, as there are lots of classes offered. We ate breakfast in Acqua twice and found it excellent both times. My wife got a massage in the spa, and said it was very nice, though very pricey ($300, with tip, for 80 minutes).

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: abkrm
Reviews.Content: I absolutely loved this hotel, the service was wonderful and I would never stay anywhere else. When we were planning our trip we didn't know where to stay, we visit Miami a lot and didn't want to stay in Southbeach so we decided on the Four Seasons. Since it was our anniversary they gave us a free upgrade to a beautiful suite with strawberries and bottled water all complimentary. The room was very clean, the whole hotel in general was in great shape. One word of advice, before considering getting room service or eating at the pricey hotel restaurant, keep in mind there is a small food stand by the gym, they have breakfast and sandwiches and salads, very good deal. There is also a restaurant by the exit to the parking garage that has all you can eat breakfast and lunch for less than $10, the food is great.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Four Seasons!”
Reviews.Author: Belli24
Reviews.Content: Just got back from the Four Seasons for our honeymoon and had an amazing time. From the moment we walked into the hotel, everyone treated us like royalty. I don't think they ever say no to anything that you ask for! Since it was our honeymoon and I informed them ahead of time, they placed a plate full of chocolate covered strawberries in our room when we arrived and a nice note. It was really a nice touch. We booked our room online for $275/night through the hotel's website with the 5th night free. I thought it was a good deal for how nice of a property you get. Even though we paid for the rack rate room (a city view) we were given a room with a partial bay view bc it was our honeymoon and I asked. When we got to the room, I saw that it was next to a large crane, so I asked to be moved. They were gracious in accommodating us and gave us an upgrade to a full bay view. It was gorgeous and we loved waking up each morning to a beautiful view. The rooms were not huge and could use a little updating (I was surprised that a 5 star hotel doesn't have flat screen TVs-- but then again, who goes to Miami to sit in their room and watch TV??). The bathroom was amazing-- all marble, a separate tub and shower and beautiful granite vanity. Overall, I would agree with earlier posts that this is a great hotel if you want to hang out by the pool. It might have one of the best hotel pools in Miami. The pool service was great. We never had trouble getting a cabana because the poolside area was not crowded. This makes a big difference if you are looking for a tranquil, quiet setting while you sunbathe (other hotel pools are crowded and you have to fight for a lounge chair). Beware that the pool side drinks and food do come at a price! $13 for a drink. We just went to the grocery store and bought some things to take down to the pool. We also liked that the pool was open 24 hrs a day, so you can take a late night dip if you like. Another nice feature is the use of the gym, which has classes and exercise equipment. The only cons I can think of are: --Food is expensive --Valet parking is also expensive (33/nt) --You need a car to get around town. Note that you are *not* in South Beach, but in the downtown financial district. I didn't mind the drive, I actually preferred being away from all the craziness of SoBe and just going there for dinner. Overall, an awesome experience.

Reviews.Title: “The Good and the Bad”
Reviews.Author: ziggydssp
Reviews.Content: We just completed a seven night stay at the Four Seasons in Miami. Overall we were pleased with the stay but felt the hotel did not live up to our expectation of service from a Four Seasons Hotel. Noone ever addressed us by name. I thought that was a signature for Four Seasons Hotels. The service is definitely on the cold side except for the hardworking pool attendants. They worked very hard and were always asking us if everything was okay and if we needed anything. They were just great. Housekeeping left a lot to be desired, especially considering the usual standards of Four Seasons Hotels. We asked on numerous occassions that the dirty glasses in our room be replaced but time and after time they forgot and we had to call and ask again. One day they cleaned the room and forgot to replace the toilet paper. On some days they forgot to leave bath gel. The room was spotless but they were quite forgetful. We had asked that the mini bar be emptied and they emptied it but they also locked it so we could not store anything. We had to call the front desk to have it unlocked. One morning we were awakened in error by a wake up call that was meant for another room. They apologized for the error. The hotel lobby and pool grounds are beautiful. The rooms are medium size, well appointed, and views are okay, nothing too great. There is construction going on next to the hotel and there are two big construction cranes. We could see one of the cranes from our room. The food and drinks at the pool were pretty good but nothing fabulous. Free use of the pool cabanas is a nice touch. I did not see anyone using the pool with the palm trees in it. They never offered to set our chairs up in that pool as it pictured on the web site photos. The pool with the palm trees is much smaller that you would think from looking at the web site photos. The hotel is a great respite from the constant action on South Beach. Every time I entered the hotel I felt like I was in my own sanctuary. Very quiet, great smells fill the air, it really is a relaxing environment. Free bottles of water at the valet desk and use of hotel umbrellas is also a nice touch. We went to the health club on a few days, it is very large and seems to have all the equipment one could need. The views of the city are nice, expect for the building across the stree that is under construction. We spent a lot on cabs, but felt the cab service we received was very good. We secured a great room rate throught Travelocity, we paid $200/night for all seven nights. We enjoyed our stay but really have to say that we were disappointed that the hotel did not meet our preconceived notion of Four Seasons service standards.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but....”
Reviews.Author: jrankw
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located in downtown Miami, conveniently located near Miami Beach and Coral Gables shopping (Merrick Park). The decor and service are great although nothing spectacular, that is nothing that a large commercial chain isn't. The pool is fantastic, the rooms nice, especially the bathroom decor and L'Occitane toiletries. However, the only sever downside was the room service food. The food was just way below average, in fact terrible. Rock hard bread for a sandwich and spongy pancakes for breakfast really made me question my choice of hotels. Everything else was good.

Reviews.Title: “Just bliss....”
Reviews.Author: jenki
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my partner in April. The staff and service were just fantastic. We were initially concerned about where to book in miami because of some of the review of hotels in the area, ie South Beach etc, hence we booked the Four Seasons. It did not disappoint. From the start all staff were nothing but helpful, friendly and could not do enough for you. The pool is outstanding and the staff around the pool are the same, constantly filled iced water, watermelon and lovely smoothies!! Just loved it!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms & views”
Reviews.Author: Likit7848
Reviews.Content: I just spent 3 nights at the Four Season Miami and I highly recommend it. The rooms are spacious and bathrooms to die for. I had a package overnighted to me and the hotel staff was on top of it the entire time and even tracked me down to let me know it had arrived. In typical Four Seasons style they go above & beyond and will try to cater to any request.

Reviews.Title: “Great Pool, decent service”
Reviews.Author: jangNY
Reviews.Content: If you're looking for a place to just relax and sit in the sun, this is a great hotel. The pool area is large and when we were there (mid april) not too crowded at all. The pool-side service was pretty decent (not as good as other Four Seasons I've been too) but it wasnt bad at all. The food was good, but like anywhere, gets old after a few days. Warning: this is out of the heart of the action, downtown Miami is practically a ghost town. If you want action, do not stay here! But South Beach is an easy 15 minute cab ride ($30 each way). The room was very nice but "standard". One king bed. sort of small, great bath. Ask for an upgrade. Who knows?

Reviews.Title: “Great getaway”
Reviews.Author: Sophie71
Reviews.Content: A great hotel for a quick getaway for some sun. We stayed at the Four Seasons for 3 days and it was perfect. Amazing pool, great service, nice, spacious rooms. Kid friendly. The hotel is in the business district so the neighborhood isn't 'happening' but there are some great restaurants within 3-5 block radius of the hotel so you aren't stuck with hotel restaurants only.

Reviews.Title: “A nice stay.”
Reviews.Author: MSBulldog
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently returned from a week-long stay at the Four Seasons Miami. First of all, as has been mentioned in many of the reviews, the hotel is in the Brickell Business area, which is essentially shut down after 5 PM during the week and is equally deserted on the weekends. This made for a very quiet stay, despite the fact the hotel was hosting participants in a Latin music awards program. For eating and other activities outside the hotel, however, there are limited choices. Cab rides to Coral Gables, Cocconut Grove and South Beach are likely if you stay as long as we did. You can use the metromover and metrorail systems to get around as well. The hotel lobby and rooms are very nice, exceptionally clean, and consistent with the Four Seasons we have stayed in elsewhere. The valet, bellservice, and housekeeping personnel are very nice although some language barriers do exist. We found the concierge service to be friendly but inconsistently helpful. Some of the best recommendations came from the bellmen and room service staff. The room service food was good and we were given prompt, polite attention. The pool is very nice and we were able to obtain a cabana for shade without difficulty. The servers poolside were friendly but occasionally not very attentive. Overall, I would recommend staying at the Four Seasons if business required you to be in this part of the city.

Reviews.Title: “A tranquil stay at the Four Seaons Miami”
Reviews.Author: nyluxe
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Four Seasons Miami for 4 nights in late January 2008 and I chose the property because it was close to the start of the ING Half Marathon I was running. The lobby was beautiful and filled with the fragrance of fresh flowers. We were greeted by a friendly front desk staff with an expedient check in. Our corner room was huge and had two window seats which were great for just sitting back and taking in the view of the bay (there was also a city view but honestly it wasn't that great). The beds were comforable and clean. One thing that struck me immediately was the absence of a flat screen TV. Other Four Seasons in which I've stayed in have had them.. but that's a small luxury that was missing. The concierge was amazing and helped us get around. If you stay here you will most likely need help because the hotel is really not near anything. The cab to south beach was $25 each way and there are not a lot of dining/recreation options in the vicinity. I had an amazing trip and would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great decor and wonderful atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: psnelman
Reviews.Content: Everything was perfect for our stay. The only niggle was the beds were too soft. I prefer a firm bed but it's a minor point. Otherwise perfect. I highly recommend the 4 Seasons in Miami

Reviews.Title: “A Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: ammts28
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Four Seasons Miami for 5 days last week for the marathon. I can't say enough about the hotel staff. The concierge was especially fantastic and provided great suggestions about getting around the city and making use of the people mover, which was free throughout the marathon weekend. They also recommended places to go out and generally provided a lot of information whenever we had questions. Our room was great. It was a corner room that overlooked the water and the city. Plus, we loved the window seats - the windows were lined with cushioned benches that were perfect for enjoying the views from the room. Everything was impeccably clean. One negative thing was that housekeeping tended to come late in the afternoon... usually at exactly the time we were returning to the room to shower and get ready for the evening plans. Also, we visited the Sports Club LA spa that is connected to the hotel and found the staff there to be rude and unhelpful (which was surprising because the staff in the gym side of Sports Club LA were great). Though they are not Four Seasons staff, I would have expected better from a facility that is connected to the Four Seasons.

Reviews.Title: “Good for business or holiday”
Reviews.Author: Traveller123London
