Reviews.Content: Four Seasons Miami is in the heart of Miami's downtown business district - great for business travellers but not where most tourists to Miami would ideally want to be, as there are no beaches, shopping areas, etc. within walking distance. However, we were pleasantly surprised - the pool area of the hotel is a destination in itself and the downtown location actually gives the hotel a more sophisticated and exclusive feel than you would get at a more typical holiday resort type hotel. The downtown location also didn't feel isolated - there are actually several good restaurants as well as a good Publix supermarket within walking distance so if you feel like feel like having a meal outside of the hotel or picking up some essentials it is easy to do. As one would expect from a Four Seasons, the hotel was 5- star quality - the highlight is the beautiful pool area with lots of private canopy areas so you can easily get your own canopy to spend the day under. Pool staff are very attentive - you can order drinks or food from them and they will serve you at your canopy or lounge chair. The outdoor bar area by the pool is very nice and is a must either during the day or evening - they serve lunch during the day and bar food in the evenings. On the negative side, the main hotel restaurant, Acqua, was disappointing. Food quality was sub-par and the fusion style food on the menu didn't work. Other slight negatives were that one day part of the pool area was closed for a private reception - they didn't tell us this when we booked or checked in. The outdoor bar was also closed to hotel guests one evening due to being booked for a private event. As a paying customer in a 5-star hotel you should expect to be able to use all of the main facilities all of the time. Overall, I would recommend this hotel for not only business travellers but also holiday travellers to Miami - particularly if you can get a reasonable rate.

Reviews.Title: “Solid place - at the right rate itÂ´s womderful”
Reviews.Author: johron
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here half a dozen times or so and consider it one of the top choices in Miami. We have also stayed at the following hotels in Miami: Doral, Fairmont Turnberry, The Raleigh, Loews, Ritz Carlton Key Biscayne, Astor, Beach House Bal Harbour, Shore Club, The National, and The Sagamore. The Four Seasons is the best of those. It's location might seem off, but really is not. It's easy to get to South Beach, to Coral Gables, and to the Design District. I rather preferr the quiet location in the down town business district, even for leisure stays. The pool is great, as are the rooms. The staff is friendly, but not quite up to "normal" Four Seasons standards. Many maids, for instance, do not speak English. At the right rate, this hotel is hard to beat, and they often post specials on their web sites that are remarkably good. Sometimes you can also get a better rate by calling the hotel directly. But the overall best deal, you are most likely to get by booking throgh the Coral Gables travel specialist What A Hotel. In January 2008, throgh What A Hotel, we got a suite and a double at slightly more than half the price offered at the Four Seasons home page.

Reviews.Title: “Its all about the Service!”
Reviews.Author: Clefsdorsf
Reviews.Content: The Four Seasons Miami did everything right. Its expensive--no way around it--but when you leave--you are completely satisfied. The staff is warm and welcoming and every request is met with a smile. The Chef Concierge --Carlos makes your every wish come true. My partner was celebrating a birthday--and everywhere we turned--we were met with Happy Birthday wishes. Its that sort of magic that makes you want to return again and again. Dinner in Acqua was superb--and the hotel is the ultimate in stylish and elegant. A perfect stay.

Reviews.Title: “Not Quite There”
Reviews.Author: DNewYork
Reviews.Content: Overall--This is a Four Seasons, so the rooms were beautiful and the public spaces were quite elegant. However, the hotel has several service issues that are perplexing. These inconsistencies could be a bit maddening. Room--Very spacious and pleasant. Terrific marble bathrooms and the best part is the window seat, which allows guest to feel as though they are perched above the city while enjoying the sun. I felt like a lucky cat. Maid Service--Clean and to the point. Nothing out of the ordinary, but no complaints here. Food--Very good food for room service and very good food at the restaurant. Pool Area--Very open and relaxing and huge space. Gym--One of the best parts of the hotel. The gym is the LA Sports club, which has everything one needs. Service--Here I have to admit there were a few snafus. There was the reservation issue with Platinum AMX, which consisted of rate confusion and whether or not our card was supposed to be charged ahead of time. These issues were resolved, but not without a headache. Then there was the issue of me asking the concierge is he could suggest a catering service for a small party we were having at an apartment in South Beach. The guy never even called back with information or an explanation that he could not help us. Normally I would understand these small missteps, but at the Four Seasons? My experiences at their other properties were antithetical to this. In short, they need to work on service. Comparison to Mandarin Oriental--Two weeks after my stay at the Four Seasons, my partner and I spent a week at the Mandarin. Alas, the Four Seasons did not even come close to that experience.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Four Seasons”
Reviews.Author: SantaMonicaMax
Reviews.Content: This was the second time that I have stayed at this hotel. I loved it the first time and thought the second was just as good. The rooms, as you would expect, were spotless. The beds were extremely comfortable and due to the height of the building the room had a pretty stunning view of Miami! Although it was in October it was still warm enough to enjoy the pool. The staff were very attentive as we lounged in our cabana's. The concierge was very helpful also in organising an off the cuff trip to the Everglades to have a tour on one of the air boats. It was great fun and I highly recommend it! The one downside of this hotel is it's location. It's miles away from South Beach and takes 20 - 30 mins to get there depending on the traffic. If your plans in Miami do not involve mad nights out in South Beach then this is the place for you, if it does expect to fork out a few dollars in cab rides!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Micky87
Reviews.Content: Great hotel. This hotel has the best rooms and spas I have ever seen. I cant explain it because it is so perfect. I had the some of the best food ever. VISIT THIS HOTEL. I would also recommend the Sofitel Miami.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Experience”
Reviews.Author: investr
Reviews.Content: Our 5-night stay at the Four Seasons was fantastic. The one-bedroom Bayview Suite had a great view, beautiful interior, and excellent layout. The hotel was also quite, the staff extremely nice and helpful, and valet parking of our car was efficient. All very different from what you encounter at the noisy, hip, remodeled old hotels on S. Beach. Had dinner one night at Acqua restaurant and really enjoyed it. We traveled to Miami many times over the years, and have found this hotel, the Mandarin Oriental, & the Ritz-Carlton Coconut Grove to be our clear favorites.

Reviews.Title: “Four Seasons -- Very Nice But Could Be Better”
Reviews.Author: Traveler1896
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent Thanksgiving week at the Four Seasons in Downtown Miami. The downtown area is a bit of a ghost town at night. A few towers sit dark & empty. Others remain under construction. However thereâ€™s some life sprouting-up in the area. New restaurants & bars, along with a great basketball arena & a beautiful opera house are bringing some much-needed energy to a long-neglected part of town. The Four Seasons is certainly doing its part to build on that momentum. Located in the tallest building in Miami, the hotel is sleek & modern. The lobby is visually stunning with its high ceilings & stylish decor. It even smelled nice â€“ like an English garden after a spring rain. Sports Club LA is located here too & guests have access to the gym which is a huge plus. Our room was very comfortable with impressive skyline views. The swimming pool is located on the 7th floor. The setting is perfect. A large outdoor pool along w/a Jacuzzi & a wading pool w/palm trees. Itâ€™s an oasis among the high rises! However we concluded that the service at the Four Seasons didnâ€™t quite match-up to its beautiful setting. We base this assessment also on previous stays at other FS hotels. We hope FS Miami will take the following points as constructive criticism! Overall, our stay at the Four Seasons was very good but not excellent. For one thing, the pool could use a facelift. Parts of the pool has paint chipping & I detected several noticeable cracks along the perimeter of the pool. The patch-up job done on some of the cracks looked very sloppy. The maid service was unsatisfactory. For example, the maids were chintzy with the shampoo & conditioner. We had to call & ask for extra bottles a couple of times. Then things started to mysteriously disappear from our room. First it was the waste paper basket in our bathroom. Then it was the Do Not Disturb sign (which was last seen INSIDE our room). We laughed it off at first. I mean, we never experienced hotel staff allegedly stealing hotel items! But it became irritating because none of the items mentioned were returned or replaced. Finally, in other Four Seasons establishments, we always found little treats on our pillow; a strategically-placed bookmark on the book sitting on the bedside table or toiletries arranged symmetrically by the sink. These Four Seasons touches were conspicuously missing. My wife & I started to think that maybe we were placed in a section of the hotel which was relegated for less-desirable travelers. We started calling our floor the â€œOrbitz Floor.â€� In conclusion, we believe a few minor improvements would bring the Miami branch up-to-par with the excellence that the Four Seasons is known for. We'll continue to stay at the Four Seasons domestically & internationally.

Reviews.Title: “Just go and enjoy it... Soak it in...”
Reviews.Author: andyfromtoronto
Reviews.Content: - the beds are heaven - Afternoon tea was wonderful, the desserts were a treat, sandwiches were delicious, service impeccable - chicken soup was wonderful and great for my mild cold - Service overall was impeccable, informative, resourceful, had everything at their fingertips, made all reservations for us, ready to deliver bandaids, scissors etc to our room, speedy service - Pool was lovely - door-men were friendly and helpful, always ready to help us with taxis Bars in the area - Novacento closes early around 2ish? but Blue Martini was fantastic, they took great care of us ther and treated us VIP all the way... 100% recommend it Gift shop was nice, i bought beautiful cufflinks and a sparkly ring... The lady who worked there was semi-helpful... The neighborhood and hotel are peaceful, a complete contrast to the South Beach neighborhood and hotel we were in previously... I have no tips or further notes... staying there was perfect, and we required nothing... just go and enjoy it... soak it in...

Reviews.Title: “Excellence in Miami! (Didn't think it was possible)”
Reviews.Author: roar_03
Reviews.Content: I usually go to Miami a few times a year. For some reason I have never stayed at the FS, I have to ask myself why? Having stayed at the Conrad next door and several hotels in South Beach I can say this is the best i have experienced in Miami. (Although i have not stayed at the Mandarin Oriental) The hotel is lovely. The lobby and particularly the Botero sculptures are magnificant. We stayed in a premier bay view room - Great views of the bay, well executed color scheme and the usual tasteful FS bathroom. If you have a choice get a bay view room. Looking back at the city is not great. Much of Miami downtown is a construction site. Service was excellent. Everyone remembered and pronounced my rather long last name. The restaurant "Aqua" is pretty good. My mother is a vegetarian- they had no trouble accommodating her requests. The wine list is good and reasonable for a FS. The pool area is well designed and landscaped. The staff is attentive. There is one downside. If you stay here have a car. There is nothing to do downtown that you can walk to. Shop and eat in south beach walk around on lincoln road but stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Palm Trees In the Sky With Jasmine.”
Reviews.Author: KSergey
Reviews.Content: Saying that this hotel is great you say nothing. Itâ€™s just fantastic â€“ from the very beginning when the hotelâ€™s limousine picked me up at the airport till my departure â€“ I have never experienced before such an outstanding service like theirs. Style, Chique, Beauty, Comfort, High Professionalism and Friendliness â€“ all these features are combined into unique spirit of the Four Seasons Miami. Every day I couldnâ€™t help admiring the personnelâ€™s readiness to meet all my needs. Iâ€™d like to especially point out pool attendants, restaurant staffs and concierge service â€“ all of them do a great job! Thanks, guys! The building of the Four Seasons is the highest one in Miami. I enjoyed a lot its architectural concept combining three functionally different areas: the stylishly decorated ground floor lobby with the marble wall fountain at the entrance; the main service area on the 7th floor with reception, main lobby, restaurants, boutiques and three big pools; and finally the guestrooms area on the higher floors. But most of all Iâ€™m impressed by its pools system surrounded by tropical garden with palm trees and flourishing jasmine bushes and flowers. And all this paradise is created in the open air on the seventh floor with a wonderful view of the city and ocean! Unbelievable! Donâ€™t miss a chance to visit this terrific place while in Miami. â€œYouâ€™re home, sirâ€� â€“ the first words I heard entering the hotel. And thatâ€™s true.

Reviews.Title: “good hotel -- bad timing”
Reviews.Author: TravelDIVA3
Reviews.Content: The Hotel room was great....unfortunately we traveled during the wrong time of the year, arrived on the first day of hurricane season. The restaurant was good, i'm sure during high season it's wonderful. Hotel did try hard, restaurant the air conditioned is turned up so high they provide the ladies with pashminas. Lots of Latino celebrities staying and dining there, I even met my music hero! Service is good...very Four Seasons,,,,great service and location...

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Four Seasons Hotel Miami”
Reviews.Author: srayburn
Reviews.Content: We had a beautiful time at the Four Seasons Hotel in Miami. Our party consisted of two adults and two children, aged 16 and 3. The pool was a great feature, with the large shallow pool being a big hit w/ our toddler. The 16 year old appreciated the pool side cabanas and all of us loved the great service. Concierge service was excellent, they sent us to some great restaurants. The room and bathroom were wonderful, we had a corner room with water and city view. My only complaint would have to be with the quality of food at the pool side grill... not what it should be for the money and location. Overall I would recommend the hotel to a friend and would stay again in a heartbeat... hope to be back soon.

Reviews.Title: “Another terrific stay at the Four Seasons”
Reviews.Author: Annielovestotravel
Reviews.Content: From start to finish, a terrific stay at the Four Seasons. While technically not in the "thick of the scene," this hotel has nothing to apologize for. South Beach is a mere 10 minutes by car, and frankly, at the end of a long day, it was nice to retire to a hotel that wasn't full of raging 22-year-olds. We considered the Setai as an alternative, but found the Four Seasons had larger rooms and a little less attitude. The restaurant, Acqua, was lovely. Had dinner and breakfast there, and both were flawless. To give you a sense of just how good they are--my traveling companion wore a black dress to breakfast one morning and they made sure to give her a black napkin--god forbid a white napkin leave lint on her! It's just those little touches that make the Four Seasons stand out. We were upgraded to a room on a high floor with a view of the bay. Stunning. Our room even had a little window seat area, where I read my morning paper each day and ate some of the fresh fruit they had left for us. The bathrooms are enormous and have all the amenities you expect--the plush and plentiful towels, the soft and cuddly bathrobes, the L'Occitane products, and always a full stock of cotton balls and Qtips. There were more than enough hangers of every variety in the closet, and plenty of drawer space for your clothing. The valet service was flawless (prompt, friendly and always willing to give accurate directions) and they always offered us a much-needed bottle of ice-cold water as we departed and returned to the hotel. The concierge was terrific. We wanted to purchase gifts for friends who live in Miami and they sent us to all the right boutiques--exactly what we were looking for. Finally, and I know this will sound weird, but the hotel had a great smell. Yes, I said smell. I don't know if they're pumping extra oxygen in the hotel, or if they have some sort of fragrance system in place, but it always smelled fresh and clean and airy. It was so lovely to come "home" to that each day.

Reviews.Title: “Pure Luxury”
Reviews.Author: saintba
Reviews.Content: I've always had great experiences in the Four Seasons chain. This was no exception. I only booked one night here as I was flying from Madrid back to Buenos Aires via Miami. I routed the trip through Miami so I could do some shopping before I came back to South America (I live in Buenos Aires). I was very tired after the trip from Madrid and the time zone difference and 9 hour flight. I rented a car and hit the hotel. The hotel is very nice and I'd recommend booking a room with a view. The hotel is no on the beach but they have some good views. The bathroom amenities are especially nice. The service as usual at the Four Seasons chain is very good. The gym and spa which I used were very very nice and although it's pricey (about u$s 400 per night) for a nice suite it's worth it. I'd gladly stay here again. A very nice property with helpful and courteous employees.

Reviews.Title: “Not up to other Four Seasons”
Reviews.Author: aridoberman
Reviews.Content: When I contacted the property to book a room I was treated very well. Not the same when we arrived at the hotel. The room was not ready well after check in time and the guy at the front desk had some attitude that I didn't like at all, probably because I look younger than I really am and he thought he was dealing with a kid on spring break. Kid or not, they should treat everybody with courtesy and respect, what everybody else in the hotel did, especially the maids of the floors that are great, always smiling and do a great job. Leave them a few $ each day of your stay, they deserve it, because cleaning rooms is not the nicest job to do. The pool area is very disappointing, contrary to what most of the reviews says. One of the pools was out of service and it looked very sad to look at. The gym is complimentary and nice, but not as good as the Four Seasons' gym of San Francisco. The rooms are nice, but in the pics of the hotel, they look much better. The bathroom is very nice and spacious. If you pay more than $200/night, I don't know if you will be satisfied or not.

Reviews.Title: “Spectacular View, consistent service”
Reviews.Author: Iloveboutiquehotels
Reviews.Content: This is my second time staying at this hotel and since my second stay was just as good as the first stay back in June 2004 I think it's worth writing a review. Despite the fact that Four Seasons Hotels tend to have a cookie cut feel for many of their hotels, this one felt different! The room was very similar to their newer properties, especially the bathroom with L'Occitane amenities. However what sets them apart from other Four Seasons is their sports club. They have every single equipment you can think of and classes running all day. I wish I had more time to workout... the rest of my spare time was spent by the pool where friendly staff brought me frozen fruit. I loved the twice daily room refresh, I'm embarrassed to say I took the big bath soap to take home and found they replaced that when I returned to my room in the afternoon!

Reviews.Title: “Splendid ! Don't stay anywhere else”
Reviews.Author: H0telGuru
Reviews.Content: This hotel is amazing. Although not on the beach, it is in a pretty nice area of Brickell, right by the bay. The hotel looks brand new, has an amazing lobby with beautiful art, just exudes luxury. The pool, ah, the pool. Probably the best pool in Miami, huge, very classy and oasis like. and the best hotel gym in Miami, period. The rooms are great, not huge, but very very comfortable and classy, well decorated, and with incredible bathrooms. Have had a great stay, and will come back. If you want luxury and pampering without the craziness of SoBe (but being able to enjoy SoBe with a short drive), stay here.

Reviews.Title: “interesting expirience”
Reviews.Author: ACPACPACP
Reviews.Content: At the For Seasons Miami you a rather renting a condo as a hotel room. The whole building is designed for condos, which they even sell to you. For unknown reasons to me, things worked out that they made a hotel out of it. So this is the upside on this hotel, the 'rooms' are HUGE (at least mine was). Unbeatable price-squarefeet ratio. The downside was, that service was rather condo-style than hotel-style: The 'Minibar' (in fact a fullsize refrigrator in a fully staffed kitchen) wasn't refilled once in our 3 nights-stay, and even not charged at checkout. They simply forgot about it. A matter of taste was the design of the lobby and the rooms, some might like the minimalistic grey style around, I found it too cold.

Reviews.Title: “not the best 4 seasons”
Reviews.Author: beatoangelico
Reviews.Content: excellent communal areas, beautiful pool (the staff is very attentive), nice staff at the concierge. Bad aspects: not on the beach, not in South beach (where the real social life is). room (we had a junior suite) confortable but a little impersonal. Big complains about the housekeeping: after breakfast we returned in to the room and the staff was there for cleanings; we asked 2 times if they could come back after 10 minutes.... they didn't do it. If you want a cappuccino or espresso at the breakfast these are extras.... only included tea or american coffee. Don't go there if you go for nightlife or life at the sea. Can be nice if you plan to visit more the city

Reviews.Title: “Generally Good Stay”
Reviews.Author: BrynMawrBK
Reviews.Content: My two young daughters (9 and 11) and I stayed at the Four Seasons Miami this past Presidents' Day weekend, and had a positive experience overall. Unlike some other reviewers, we found all the staff to be friendly and pleasant. Our one-bedroom suite was spacious and comfortable, the FREE rollaway bed (the Ritz-Carlton Key Biscayne charges $50.00 per night for a rollaway!) and pullout couch were always promptly made up or put away when we called Housekeeping, and all the food was great, whether room service, poolside lunches, or Acqua Restaurant. The two-acre pool deck off the lobby is amazing and gorgeous, though windy -- you're seven stories up, so maybe that's why. We spent nearly the entire weekend on-site, since the pool deck is so pleasant. Be aware that this hotel is on a street with no shopping and only two restaurants close by -- everything else seems to be office buildings, so to have something to do, you have to take a cab somewhere. Two complaints: First - the hotel write-up brags about having three pools. In fact, only two are available to hotel guests: the other large pool is exclusively for the use of condo owners in the building. Why not advertise as many pools as you can see from the property, since that's as much use as you'll get out of the ones beyond the two actually open to guests? Second, the spa/salon menu on the website advertises a private room for mother-daughter (or other twosome) services such as pedicures. Wanting to give my daughters a treat, I scheduled simultaneous pedicures for the three of us, and had to call the salon at least four or five times while they worked to find a time that all three of us could be in the private room. When we arrived (early in the morning because that's the only time they said we could be accomodated), one of the three pedicure chairs was already occupied by an older gentleman, whose pedicure lasted the entire time my daughters were getting theirs. I skipped getting my pedicure to avoid having my daughters sit around and wait for me, and told the receptionist I was dissatisfied with not getting the advertised and booked mother-daughters pedicure. She passed the message along to the manager, who was not present, but it was clear they didn't really care, and I was never contacted by anyone (nor was anything done to mollify me). The pedicures cost $65.00 apiece and were not nearly as thorough as the ones we get at home for about one-third the price -- definitely not worth the money, but the whole idea was to have a special experience with my daughters, which I didn't. Other than these two things, the hotel is very nice and worth a stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Family Weekend”
Reviews.Author: childrenssherpa
Reviews.Content: We visited the hotel for just a time-out weekend in January with our 2 girls ages 9 and 11. At first we were worried that we should have stayed closer to the beach, but after one afternoon on the strip at South Beach, the Four Seasons was welcome oasis. South Beach was a bit too much of a freak show for the children (even though we are New Yorkers). The pool deck overlooking the bay and nearby condos is perfect for a day or 2 of relaxing and the staff and drinks are welcoming (the Brazillian drinks especially tasty). The children were able to amuse themselves the entire time, swimming and exploring the 2 acre deck. We adults enjoyed excellent massages in the spa and the children had pedicures and haircuts. All very swanky. The haircuts were less expensive than my local salon in NYC. My only gripes are that the Acqua restaurant is a bit sterile, and we would have like to hang out at the poolside Bahia bar in the evening after the kids were in bed. Unfortunately, a corporate event had closed the bar to guests. (A bit annoying given what we were paying for those 2 nights!) If that is standard procedure on weekends--ask before booking if there are any closures of that sort. Note also that the rooms are deluxe, the views lovely, but in most rooms, no balcony or fresh air. It is a glass and steel tower after all. There is a touch of that corporate downtown expense account feel. In other words--this is not luxury adventure travel a la the Caves in Jamaica, but it is convenient and just fine for a short get-away. Big Props to Steve Goth in the security department who mailed me back my daughter's winter coat left in the room. And finally, note that no matter how organized and efficient the Four Seasons is, the Miami airport is an absolute zoo on a Sunday afternoon, so don't be lulled into cutting the hotel to airport time too short in order to have one last swim in the gorgeous pool.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service, Great Gym, Nice Bath, OK Room”
Reviews.Author: kyoto5301
Reviews.Content: We found the service impeccable in every regard. The gym was one of the best associated with a Hotel that we have used; it had windows all around it, and very good equipment. (I suggest getting a schedule of group classes at check in, if interested, as there are many). The bathroom and toiletries were excellent. The room was tasteful, but not special. The pool is lovely. A few minuses: there was no cofee maker in the room. There is nothing much in the neighborhood (not much shopping, restaurants). Note: this hotel is not near the beach.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful”
Reviews.Author: Vikster7
Reviews.Content: Stunning hotel, amazing service, beautiful food, fantastic suite. Really nothing bad to say about this hotel at all. Probably the best hotel i've ever stayed in. We got upgraded for a minimum amount, it is a VERY expensive hotel but worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Welcoming, Relaxing, and Healthy! We loved the FS Miami.”
Reviews.Author: Goodmorning2U
Reviews.Content: Hello, The Four Seasons Hotel is our favorite hotel in Miami, for a relaxing healthy getaway. This is the fifth time we have stayed at the Four Seasons Miami and it gets better with every visit. We were warmly greeted at the front door by the valet with an immediate offer to help us with our luggage. Upon entering the lobby we were again warmly greeted by Drew, Gabriel, and, remembering us from a previous visit by the wonderful Alvin Tham, and quickly checked into our room. The rooms are the highest quality currently available in Miami. They are a very spacious 550 sqf decorated with sleek bright very comfortable furniture and bed. The bathrooms are equally spacious with the tubs perfect for deep soaking and the shower water pressure strong. Terry cloth robes are thick and enveloping. They welcomed our small dog (without a deposit or extra cost) providing him with a special welcome amenity (he never eats dog treats but he loved the ones the Four Seasons gave him). Outside of our room retreat we took full advantage of the Sports Club LA a short elevator ride away. This enormous gym provides hotel guests complimentary yoga classes, spinning classes, weight training classes, step etc. The spa, Splash, is very good though I wish that they offered manicures and pedicures. These services are offered on the hotel premises but by another salon occupant called Rikrak. We both had massages which were uniformly excellent, providing just the relaxation we needed. The hotels private Olympic pool and manicured acres surrounding it are unparalled. The restaurant, Aqua, serves a fabulous dinner and Sunday Brunch, the lamb is exceptional as is the baramundi (white fish, ask for it without the skin). It was our anniversary and after asking the pastry chef if he could surprise my spouse with something he recommended a plate of chocolate cookies. I was skeptical but when I SMELLED them outside the door to be delivered I knew they were the right choice. Hats off to their French pastry chef. Thank you for another wonderful stay. We are looking forward to returning...

Reviews.Title: “Loved my bay view room but..”
Reviews.Author: andrea.italian
Reviews.Content: Second stay at the FS Miami after my first stay one year ago. Obviosly the hotel is still the same , the bay view room is a beatiful room with a fantastic view and a good size. However I did find some small problems compared with the past stay of August 2005: 1) In an hotel like the FS you're expecting the best and the tv system of the FS Miami is not up to the best standard now available. I was expecting a change to a Flat screen tv.. 2) The hotel staff has changed and some of them ( especially at the reception ) are not very polite. I found a much more warm welcome the past time 3) The Aqua restaurant has changed menu and type of cuisine , not more Italian but much more american. The chief is new and he's from Thailand.. For me an horrible change , the Italian menu was much much better.. And the service is very slow, the same for breakfast , lunch or dinner.. 3) The pool area is fantastic but the service is not of the same level. Valet parking is good but I'd like better the valet at the RC.. Second stay and probably the last one.. Next time I will try a different hotel in Miami , probably the Mandarin Oriental.

Reviews.Title: “one of the finest experiences”
Reviews.Author: rahulrch
Reviews.Content: A true gem! We stayed here for a weekend in August and loved every moment of it. You should use the valet service as it is quick and efficient (will cost you $30 a night, though). The concierge (Rod) was extremely helpful and planned the entire weekend for us. The pool is the best we have experienced till date (clean, perfect temperature). The pool staff is courteous and pleasant. The hotel has a fantastic 40,000 sq feet Sports club/LA gym and all exercise classes are complimentary for guests. The rooms are up to any FS standards with complimentary evening turn-down housekeeping. I would definetely return to this property for the service and facilities. We did not eat at the restaurants but the sunday brunch looked sumptuous. However, be warned that this hotel is in downtown Miami and not in Miami Beach and there is absolutely nothing but buildings and construction around. We did not mind as we spent all our time at Miami Beach (15 minute drive away).
